Reviews.Title: “Elegant, inviting, comfort, off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: quete
Reviews.Content: Our first time at this beautifully renovated hotel which captures the essence of Venice. We walked to the hotel from the Santa Lucia Train Station which took about 25 minutes. It is off the beaten path but depending on the weather they do have a complimentary water taxi that will take you to St. Mark's Square. Or enjoy the sites along the way and walk to the square....25 minutes. Wonderful helpful staff, sumptuous breakfast every morning, bar lounge- restaurant on site. Worth every cent. We stated 3 glorious nights! We will return! Would recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Michael and Janine”
Reviews.Author: Michael O
Reviews.Content: Giuseppe Portrandolfo and Mariana Ferreira were superb in every regard. Courteous, professional, helpful and caring to a fault. the entire staff were constantly engaged in ensuring that our stay was beyond expectations. the property itself was immaculate. Room was large and always refreshed. all the amenities were perfect and abundant. the garden area in the back was restful; large and green and the ice house remains are a little known attraction to travelers and right in your back yard.. grocery store, wine shops, bistro's, vaparetto, were all within minutes walking distance. Maps are a "general help" as the roads are not clearly marked once you get into the interior, but hard to get lost ! San Marco is only an hour's walk and the Rialto bridge about 25 minutes. the hotel also provides a free taxi service to both San Marco and Murano........beautiful boat and beautiful locations.... we were there for our 25th anniversary and the staff and again, Mariana and Giuseppe made sure we felt special the entire week. will be going back next year and bringing the family. Venice felt very safe and very friendly all times of the day and night. although most places have a seat tax, you can sit for hours and no one hurries you along....the walk to the train station and the grand canal although less than 30 minutes can take your entire day with so much to see and do.....

Reviews.Title: “meraviglioso!”
Reviews.Author: DanandNina
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were fortunate to stay six nights at Boscolo Venezia. The hotel is in a quiet residential area, a 15 minute walk from the hectic tourist areas.Transit from the airport to the hotel was simple. Just purchase the 25 Euro ticket (round trip = andata e ritorno) at the airport machine, and follow the walkway to the Alilaguna Linea Arancio vaporeto. Get off at the first stop, Madonna del' Orto. From there it is an easy 5 minute walk to the hotel. We started each day with the ample and delicious breakfast buffet, which also included a variety of hot dishes to order. The restaurant staff, Bane and Codu, were delightful. We initially stayed in a beautiful room, looking out over the lagoon. Unfortunately, the mosquitos (zanzari) were pleased to join us. The staff was very accommodating, and we moved to a gorgeous room (202) overlooking the canal, where we slept soundly with the windows open each night. The front desk staff (Martina, Philip, and Rositza) were outstanding, and so tolerant of my attempts to improve my Italian. Before we set out to explore Venice each day, the staff would make our dinner reservations. Osteria L'orto dei Mori, Algiubagio, and Ostaria da Rioba were each excellent, and after long days walking and walking, it was perfect to dine nearby the hotel. The staff kindly sent a gift of wine and antipasto to our room to celebrate our anniversary. I only wish we could hear those sweet church bells again now! Dan & Nina, Hershey PA

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Property - Highly Recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: KenVets
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 2 nights at this fantastic resort. I am a platinum member with Marriott and average about 90 nights a year, so I see my share of Marriott properties. Without a doubt, we were thoroughly impressed with this resort. I was a bit nervous after reading some of the reviews, but in my opinion, i think thte most common complaints are not justified, and I'll explain. First, the hotel staff - we were checked in by Daniel, who was incredibly polite and informative every time we saw him at the front desk - Daniel really impressed us. He took us to our room and answered some basic questions we had, while a porter brought our luggage. We were in room 404, and our room was HUGE compared to what I was expecting! Granted, we were upgraded, but I was still expecting a closet-sized room - after all, we're in Venice! The manager, I can't recall her name, was also extremely polite and friendly, and the entire staff spoke English very fluently. Some people have complained about the hotel's location, but I just dont understand why... It's a 10-15 minute walk to the grand canal, a 7 minute walk to the shops (including a very large grocery store), and there are numerous restaurants within a 5 minute walk... And the Madonna dell'Orto Vaparetto is only a 5-7 minute walk... And the hotel provided shuttle service to St Marks and (I believe) Murano island, although we didnt use the shuttle and rarely used the Vaparetto. Breakfast was included for us at no charge, but it is rather expensive, I believe â‚¬35 per person. We ate breakfast at the hotel each morning and it was very good, although I probably would not have done so for ~$100 USD total. Our room did get a bit warm, and the only way we found to cool it down was to open the window, but it wasnt a big deal. We had a great time in Venice and cant wait to go back, and when we do, we will no doubt be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Ever Stay Here - RIPOFF!!”
Reviews.Author: Adam N
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went on a 19 day honeymoon through Italy and Greece and stayed at every type of hotel from 50 Euro hotels to 300 Euro hotels. And even though Boscolo Venice was 200 Euros a night, it was the worst hotel we stayed at. 1) There was no air conditioning and no screens on the windows. So even though the temperature was not too hot at night, because we had to sleep with the windows open mosquitos came in the room the entire night. My wife barely slept and hid completely under the covers the entire night. We had bites all over us for days. 2) The reception staff was not very good. When we arrived they told us that they wish they could do something for us for our honeymoon. That was a nice wish, but other hotels (some much cheaper in price) gave us bottles of sparkling wine and even cake. This hotel did nothing. When we tried to use Marriott certificates to pay for the room (thank God I didn't spend real money on this hotel) they tried to not accept the certificates. 3) The breakfast is Horrible! Do not pay for breakfast here. We got it for free because I am a Marriott Gold member. But it cost 33 Euros for others. The breakfast was barely worth eating, even for free. If for some reason you don't listen to me and still stay here, at least skip the breakfast. 4) The hotel is right next to a famous church, Madonna Dell Orto. The problem is the church rings its bells at the most random times. And they are extremely loud. I remember around 6:30am one morning, I counted the bells ringing over 100 times. There is no way to sleep through it and it happens over and over throughout the morning and evening. The location is far from St. Marks and many of the touristy spots in Venice. We actually liked that. But it is about a 30 minute walk. The boat shuttle is worthless as it only leaves around 3 times a day. There are some local spots around the hotel we liked also. But take my advice and DO NOT STAY HERE. There are cheaper and much better hotels elsewhere in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: 119Clipboard
Reviews.Content: we had a lovely 3 nights here. we arrived very late at night and they were very accommodating. we made the mistake of paying for a water taxi from the airport to this hotel front door which we need not have done (this took us 20 minutes from the airport to hotel). our return to the airport we got a boat from the boat station down one street at the back of the hotel and it cost 13 euros each and also took 20 minutes! Due to the hotel being on the side of the airport rather than further south it is very near. We only ate breakfast at the hotel, very good, lovely cold meats, cheese, cereal selection etc - only thing which we both found annoying was on every morning the coffee was cold/luke warm at breakfast. Room facing garden was lovely and very quiet. Hotel provide a Free water taxi to Murano glass but be warned, you arrive at the factory and they try and hard sell you glass then offer you a free trip back to the hotel from the same entry station. We went out of another door from the factory and walked around the island and also found many many more glass shops/factories which were a lot cheaper and also fun to see/watch them make glass. a 3 day excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: natty3816
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel, earlier this month. The reason we picked it, was that it has recently become a Marriott property. We were not disappointed in any way. Had a fabulous room, overlooking the canal, that oozed old world charm. The hotel is situated on a canal, and a short walk from two vaporetto stops. Remember that if you don't take a water taxi (which are expensive) you will have to drag your suitcases, over cobblestones and over bridges to get to the hotel. The hotel has its own water taxi, that takes you to St. Marks Square, which is convenient and very fun, but it does not take you back and forth from the train station or airport. It has the largest private garden in Venice, which is totally enchanting, and unexpected. Must be great for weddings. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and gave us excellent tips for dining each night, that were walking distance from the hotel. The lobby is enchanting, with Murano glass chandeliers, that add charm, to this beautifully restored buidling that was formerly an embassy. I would recommend it to anyone, especially a Marriott customer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Property, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: cscott6
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 6 night stay in Boscolo Venezia, and I can say that the hotel was excellent. We had a great trip, and the hotel is absolutely beautiful. We had a king bed that overlooked the neighborhood to the left of the hotel and the Madonna Dell'Orto Tower. We had great weather last week and slept with the windows open and woke up to the church bells every morning. The hotel staff was very friendly and greeted us every morning and every evening when we came in. They answered any questions and offered maps and directions. The hotel garden is beautiful, and I enjoyed taking a cup of coffee every morning to the end of the garden and standing on the pier in the back of the hotel. This hotel is away from the crowds, but there is a grocery store, restaurants, bakery, wine shop, any thing you need very close by. The hotel does not provide conditioner, so if you need hair conditioner, be sure to bring it, or there is a grocery store one block away. There is a spa onsite, and we were allowed to use the spa for one hour a day. However, we did not realize this so did not bring anything to go into the spa (swim suit, etc). From the airport, take the Alilaguna Linea Arancio (Orange line). The Madonna del'Orto (or Orto) stop was a very short (less than 5 minutes) and easy walk to the hotel (flat and no bridges). The Orto is also the first stop. On the return to the airport, the first boat is at 7:30AM and will arrive at the airport around 8AM (this was the schedule in March). Our flight was at 9:25AM and worked perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line”
Reviews.Author: Leon G
Reviews.Content: IÂ´ve stay in this hotel in february 2012. It was an awesome experience back in this hotel; nice rooms you feel like you were in a museum, awesome and friendly staff at front desk, dinner and breakfast restautant, incredible private garden, excellent food, nice and quiet neighbourhood; free ship to Saint MarcÂ´s square; the only thing is our rooms has a little bit hot and noisy during the day at nigth was fine. I definitively will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A magical palace right on the waterfront”
Reviews.Author: See-Tai-Fan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are travelling through Europe, we booked this hotel using Marriiott points. We enjoyed it so much, we extended our stay from 2 days to 5 days. The hotel and staff are full of old world charm. The building dates from the 1600s and was originally a palace, then a consulate and also a monastery. It has front and back entrances on adjacent canals and the public ferry service stop is close nearby. You can also walk across the bridges and go to St Mark's Square in about 20 minutes if you don't get lost, but getting lost is half of the fun in Venice where every small street brings more surprises. Although we were there in a time of record cold, the hotel was warm and comfortable, the decor and surroundings were amazing and the staff were so helpful and friendly. The breakfast selection was one of the best we have ever seen. We will definitely come back here ansd it has given us wonderful memories to keep forever.

Reviews.Title: “Beware before you stay here”
Reviews.Author: kenellefson
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife have been traveling for 15 days thru Spain and Italy and we have stayed in all the hotels that have ties with Marriott due to our elite status but this particular hotel in Venice has been the worst experience we have had when we checked in we had a young gentleman very attentive but his inglish was very hard to understand our first room was so small there was barely room to walk out of the bed wen I went to take a shower the shower fell and hit my head well the changed our room after we had unpacked the other room did not have a shower that's something I usually won't check.they did not honor the rate I had on my reservation thru Marriott and also they did not honor the Spa discount that was in my room there was no way to reason with this people I WILL NEVER STAY IN THIS BRAND OF HOTEL THERE ATTITUDE WAS RUDE AND NOT ACOMODATING AT ALL ONLY FOR THEM **********BE CARFUL**********

Reviews.Title: “We <3'd Venice”
Reviews.Author: JandJthehotelslaves
Reviews.Content: We needed a holiday quickly so booked the night before 6 hours later we were at Manchester airport on our way to Venice for a few days. We loved it. Its a place to be seen, the atmosphere is fantastic no cars, its so calm and just what we needed as we were so stressed we just needed a break! We stayed at the Dei Dogi Boscolo Venezia, Autograph Collection. What can I say we had a room overlooking the front over the canal it was nice well apointed and comfortable bed. The staff were excellent we got delayed on the flight there and were stuck at Munich airport on the runway for 2.5 hours! So you could imagine when we got there we just wanted to get to the hotel, they had stopped serving food as it was late. However they were really accomodating they had the chef make us some room service we just asked for 2 tomato and mozarella salad, 2 spaghetti, a bottle of water and a bottle of the house white the total was 120 something euros!!! we were shocked until we went into Venice the next day and everything is overpriced! I tell you what though that was the best meal we had whilest we were there the food was spot on even though expensive, to this day I haven't had a better spaghetti. The hotel was nicely located away from the hustle and bustle of the grand canal. It can get very noisey staying on the grand canal. Everything in Venice is in walking distance we should know as my partner dropped our map and we couldn't find our way back to the hotel and walked the entire way across venice! We used the water bus alot its really easy and a cheap way to get around we just bought a 5 day pass. If you want to take a water taxi you pay a flat 100 euro fare. We got a private boat trip to murano glass from the hotel and shown around. Was worth it although its very expensive. We bought a large brandy goblet which costs about 150 euros and is beautiful I have all my glass and tableware to match it now. We went into the Biblica San Marco, what a building it is truely amazing! As you walk around venice stop in the Churches the architecture and detail is amazing and you can go in most of them. We spent alot of time just walking around admiring the scenery so make sure you pack your walking shoes as I forgot my trainers and had to pay 130 euros for some as all I had were my UGG boots and my feet were soaked when it rained and its also very slippy! Like I said everything is expensive so you really have to watch your wallet and make sure you don't over order at dinner. Pick back street restaurants, you will be charged a fortune around the San Marco square 15 euros for a coke kind of thing. When we left Murano glass they gave us there private boat to take us where ever we wanted to go. We asked the driver to take us to a place he would go to eat and he took us to a Seafood place nearby which from outside looked nothing but was really good food and really good price! All in all a fantastic place if you just want to go away with nothing in particular in mind but to stroll around and look at the scenery and see the sights. Pack your comfortable shoes, eat in back street restaraunts to avoid paying ridiculous prices and to be frank not very good food in the main tourist spots. Ask locals if your not sure we do that anywhere we go and always works out well. Avoid later in the season when it rains alot as it floods, we were very lucky and it flooded the day after we left. Places we say to visit are Biblica San Marco and Murano Glass. This hotel is a good hotel friendly staff, well apointed rooms, clean, we got a very reasonable price with the late booking out of season, food was excellent but pricey. You would not be disappointed unless you want to be on the grand canal, its only a couple of minutes walk to the grand canal for those of you who don't care. This is not a place to take children so is the perfect adult getaway which is what we always look for when travelling. Oh and we didnt take a gondala ride because the weather wasn't great and it was overpriced and to be honest doesn't bother me that we didn't.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Amazing Staff - Beautiful Gounds & Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bistrochefgirl
Reviews.Content: Wow! As an American traveling anywhere in Europe - you don't expect a grand room - nice, clean and safe is usually what we get. This place blew us away. It's in a quiet residential area of Venice (away from the craziness - but close enough to get anywhere you need to go - they have a complimentary water taxi to Murano and grand canal / central part of town) First thing upon arrival the staff was extraordinary - so kind and accomodating - helpful and informative. We were let into our room and were so impressed. The beautiful murano glass lighting, the size of the room, beautuiful marble bath and a large king bed - the walls looked as hand painted long ago - and the garden outside....such a tranquil and beautiful place. The included breakfast was artistically displayed, happily served and delicious. If you are lucky enough to stay here, you will not be disappointed. A beautiful beginning to a special trip. Thank you Boscolo Venezia, we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Very unique property!”
Reviews.Author: photogfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property as part of a Globus tour for 2 nights. The only property in Venice with a HUGE english garden to stroll in or sit in! It is a bit on the edge of Venice...but isn't the charm of going there to walk around and explore?! The rooms are large and the bathrooms are spectacular...marble, large, well set up. The staff was extremely helpful. We brought wine into the bar that we purchased along the way...no problem, the bartender gave us glasses and chips and was happy to help when we needed. A bit hungry...we asked for an antipasta plate to eat with our wine...we were brought an amazing selection that was even too much for 4 hungry people. There is a spa onsite that we did not have time to try out. Front and back of the hotel are on water, you might get lucky enough to get a room with an amazing view! They do have a shuttle to St Marcs Square, but walk...its great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: wheretonext123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the Best of Italy Globus 11 day tour in mid Sep 2011. Remember when you are out of your normal surroundings things are different. They will not be the same as you are use to. Take it with a grain of salt and make the best of it. Hotels and food are not what you are use to. Know that going into the vacation. Very nice hotel. Has restaurant and bar and a spa you can book. But beware of prices in bar! There did not appear to be anything close by this hotel. The room is extremely nice. Has a full size safe big enough for iPad. One outlet for electric. The power appears to stay on. It has a bidet and hair dryer. They provide lotion, bath gel & salts, shampoo, no conditioner. There is small room off the lobby that has ice water and coffee all day. They also have a bucket of ice there. The bath towels are really big and nice. We liked this hotel and would stay there again. It was about a 40 minute walk from St Mark's square. Once you learn how to read the road signs it's easy to walk anywhere in Venice. Don't forget to bring your plug adapter.

Reviews.Title: “The favorite of our trip...”
Reviews.Author: GinMcG
Reviews.Content: On our two week tour of Italy, this was our favorite hotel. We were in the back building and our room was practically in the water - what amazing views. The room was large and beautifully appointed with a chandelier and a rare (for Italy) king-sized bed. It was so quiet - actually, too quiet because both mornings we did not get a wake-up call! The public areas are ornate and worth a few pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: mrswaffle
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for us as a part of a package deal, which we chose because it included return home on the Orient Express. We were quite happy that the hotel was in a quiet area as they advertised they had a private launch to ferry guests to the Piazza San Marco. Unfortunately, the week we were there, the launch was out of order - well, that's bad luck, could happen to anyone! Sadly, it ruined our guided walking tour, which was scheduled for the day after our arrival, as that then turned into a route march to the Piazza, where we were then unable to tour the basilica.The other aspect of the hotel that appealed was the fact that the hotel chain's own website made much of their restaurant - we were booked in on a bed and breakfast basis but naturally assumed we would be able to get dinner at our own expense. Unbelievably, the whole time we were there, the restaurant was closed for lunch and dinner!! They managed to produce a very mediocre buffet style breakfast, but we were lucky to get anything at all on the last day as there was very little food left! The problem with this is, the hotel is in a residential area so when we arrived on a Saturday night, most of the local restaurants appeared to be booked up, naturally enough by Venetians! Some of the staff were very friendly and helpful, some just not interested or not confident in speaking English. The interior of the hotel is stunning, but we didn't feel that this was enough to outweigh the poor service we received there.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel superb but staff need training in customer service”
Reviews.Author: RoRoF
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in October 2011. The hotel decor is magnificent and our deluxe room was spacious and beautifully appointed as was the bathroom. The hotel gardens at the back of the hotel are beautiful and well maintained. We had to wait three hours for our room as we arrived early but the receptionist did not inform us that there was tea/coffee available which would have been appreciated after a long trip. Nor did we realise that there was a complimentary launch to San Marco and only found this out from another guest. This is an excellent service and the two men in charge of the boat were charming and gracious. The luxury spa was not working during our stay which was very disappointing. There was no internet access available unless you had your own computer as apparently it was not connected. The staff need training in promoting their hotel, welcoming guests and informing them of the facilities available. Rosemary Flynn Australia

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather sleep in the streets of Venice”
Reviews.Author: sleeplessINct
Reviews.Content: This place is in the middle of NO WHERE. It's outdated and they are extremely unhelpful. They scheduled a canal tour for us - told us to meet the guide at a generalized location and they never showed. Couldn't even get our money back. The internet is HORRIBLE there as well. We are young, so we didn't mind the long walk into the hustle and bustle of Venice, but anyone else would have said 'the hell with this!". Never again. OH - and the push the MURANO GLASS tour on you like there is no tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the crowds but never a 5 star hotel. Never!”
Reviews.Author: Bunty_Burano
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous about staying in this hotel due to the reviews, but it was better than I expected, though unrecognisable from the 5 star reviews here! We went in October so the air con was not an issue, but the hotel has thin floors so is very noisy internally - the people above us sounded like elephants walking across the floor so make sure you bring ear plugs! The free shuttle boat was not working and we were not offered an alternative, but worse still the kitchens were closed for 2 weeks (!) so although breakfast was available, it was annoying to have to walk for 20 mins on our first night for a meal, as it was a bit remote. The alleyways are not very well lit so I would not recommend this hotel for solo women travellers (unless the restaurant is open and you don't venture out too late!) Breakfast was fairly poor, maybe due to the kitchens being out of action. But they did offer to cook to order hot items such as full English, scrambled eggs etc, which were ok. Room reasonable size and decor pleasant, kept very clean and lovely toiletries and robes were provided. The staff were fine, not overly smiley and friendly, but not surly or rude either. Location is excellent for being away from the crowds of Venice, and a good choice for exploring the islands of Murano, Burano etc due to the nearby vaporetto stop. I would stay here again as I liked the location, hopefully with the shuttle boat and kitchen working it would have deserved a "very good" rating. One thing I did enjoy was waking to the smell of fresh bread every morning - lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Treasure of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Ingham M
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel so beautiful I was lost for words.. In such a special place as Venice it is worth every cent to stay at a special hotel and Boscolo truly is very special. The hotel is 25min walk to San Marco Square; 10min walk to Roma Termini and Orte Ferry is around the corner: Our Room was magnificently decadent; decorated Venetian style - huge space with king double and single bed; lounge suite,wardrobes, dressing table/desk; the bathroom was also huge; stocked with beautiful bathroom supplies (which were restocked each day - not like a lot of hotels that only supply soaps, shampoos, shower caps etc on the first day and only give you 1 toilet paper roll a day which is ........ when there are three people in the room!) Your bed is turned down each night with sweets left on your pillow... The breakfast is a feast the best I have had in my extensive travels and they also have coffee and iced water in the main sitting room whenever you wish.. The staff were fantastic and the stand out for me was Phillip who was ever so helpful. Do yourself a favor when in Venice and splurge on a stay at Boscolo dei Dogi

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: VicRoc62
Reviews.Content: Incredible hotel hidden away from the unwashed masses. Great rooms. Excellent & attentive hotel staff. Loved breakfast in the garden. Complimentary water taxi shuttle. We can't get enough of this place. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and class.”
Reviews.Author: CentralVol
Reviews.Content: A very special place indeed. Each room is different from one another. The breakfast is bountiful, delicious and beautifully presented. Check-in staff are very efficient and helpful. When you come in from walking all over Venice, the hotel has raspberry and lemon iced-water or cappuccino available for your refreshment just beyond the front door. The lobby area is beautifully appointed with classic Italian detailing. I didn't want to leave after our two night stay!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet in Venice”
Reviews.Author: SargeantKinchloe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location - off the beaten path, but easy to get to where you want to go. I had a deluxe room overlooking the inside canal - it was nice, but the air conditioning was week and the room was always warm. The restaurant in the garden was great for both dinner and breakfast. Some staff were fantastic and some staff were poor.

Reviews.Title: “Dismal Customer Service, Vastly over-rated and Out of the way.”
Reviews.Author: Roger B
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself came off a 14day cruise, disembarked at Venice and needed some time to prepare and move on homeward to UK so we opted to stay at this hotel. Huge mistake. On arrival we were kept waiting for ages and our room was not accessible for over 3 hours. We were offered raspberry flavoured water, (mmm) as a refreshment against temperatures of 29C and 90% humidity outside. The staff are pompous and unfriendly, and treat you as if they are doing you a favour by letting you into the hotel. The hotel itself is impressive with chandeliers, marble floors and ornate cornice, with frescos on the walls. However our "classic" room had a fan coil air conditioner that howled and kept you awake all night and was not effective anyway. Also the bathroom suffered water pooling around the floor because the shower screen was ineffective.But the main issue was the total lack of customer service and duty of care for customers, all entrenched with a pompous holier than thou attitude. Not a good experience at all, especially in an age of customer service, client respect and general goodwill. They perhaps need to advance their duty of care programme with a little team working and in-house training, instead of just maudling on regardless, with no doubt, the rest of the chain propping them up. What goes round, comes around.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and were treated like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: JIMKChicago_Illinois
Reviews.Content: Our family vacation to Italy was highlighted by the dei Dogi! 2 teen daughters were enthralled with the hotel and accomodations. Their room was fit for a fairy tale princess. Mom & Dad also appreciated the attention to detail in their room, from the classic Murano chandelier, down to the pefectly chilled bottle of Bellini waiting when we walked in. A sense of history permeates the hotel, a quick snack in the dining room turned into a gourmet meal, the staff went out of their way to help us find the best tours, the ghost tours for the kids, and the behind the scenes tour at the Doge's Palace for the grown ups. A quick walk from the train station, a brisk 20 - 30 minutes to St. Marks - we chose to take the boats whenever possible. An easy thing to do, as dei Doge has their own launch to the square. Top notch servie from top notch staff!

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: musicfruitcake
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd visit and I felt that the service had improved. We stayed 5 nights and enjoyed reading in the tranquil garden in the late afternoon after a day at the sites. We did not take the expensive breakfast buffet but it is a short walk to a local Cafe. Apart from the air con finding a high of 34C a bit of a struggle everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “very good, but...”
Reviews.Author: IDO22
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very fancy and in a very good location, but the room was a bit too small, and the a.c. wasen`t working so good.

Reviews.Title: “5 star Hotel, but I would not give more than 4”
Reviews.Author: gaserati
Reviews.Content: The Hotel claims to be a 5star hotel, however the room I stayed in was tiny! Almost fell over my bed when entered the room. The hallway was so nosy, that I woke up every-time somebody came to the floor and entered his room. But the most disappointing thing was the extremely poor breakfast buffet, in a dark room with little daylight. Even though it was included in the fee, I preferred to go to a cozy Venetian bar and enjoy a nice coffee with cappuccino somewhere near the canals.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but......”
Reviews.Author: jefsackman
Reviews.Content: Really liked the hotel and Philippe at front desk was most helpful and pleasant BUT we arrived with 2 kids and they wanted to charge 90 euros per cot which is a cheap foldout. Found that disgraceful. Also Internet is 20 euro for 24 hours and I'd expect a classy hotel to do better. And the 6th city in Italy on this trip and the only one that charged for breakfast and at 30 euro I'd expect much much better. Quiet location away from the masses but not central. Net positive but the chain can do much more to enhance the customer experience. Also found the tranquil garden simply beautiful. And why can't good European hotels have gyms......

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and peaceful, where the locals live”
Reviews.Author: RICHSHAR
Reviews.Content: After staying in the main hub of venice this was a wonderful escape from the traffic of people and noise. On our arrival we were greeted by a pretentious women who had an inappropriate attitude, rather off hand. Once the nonsense was out of the way and we found our way to out hotel room we began to enjoy our settled environs. Our room overlooked a wee canal on the main hotel entry. This is great to watch people pass their day. A nice sun was shinning into our room. We drank red wine and watched before exploring the garden out the back which is a soft and gentle setting. Our stay here was made more enjoyable by the proximity to all the local amenities and services

Reviews.Title: “Loved our room.”
Reviews.Author: time2travelPhoenix
Reviews.Content: First, if you are riding on the water ferries from the train station it drops you off near the Dei Dogi but absolutely no signs or idea how to find it. Make sure you have a map before you head out. The hotel itself in my opinion is beautiful. We stayed in a junior suite that was huge and very unique. The sitting area outside our room was expansive and looked to be for only 4 room. It was a treat! The chandeliers were stunning right out of the Murano factory. Downside- The distance to St. Marks square although we loved being away from all the hectic noise. Also the breakfast was expensive and quite frankly they only had one poor hard working girl there with tons of tour buses leaving every morning so near impossible for a non tour person to get food or coffee without a heck of a wait and then most of the buffet items were gone. I would think they would know how to work with that problem by now. The staff were pleasant and I personally loved my room so much I would return. Of course it was a Junior Suite but highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, probably one of the better hotels in Venice”
Reviews.Author: NPatel_NJ
Reviews.Content: We actually had originally booked their sister hotel (Bellini Boscolo) because it was very close to the train station and we knew walking around with 2 large suitcases would not be fun (water taxi is EUR60 each way!). However, when we arrived, the Bellini had a small electrical fire the day before and had no electricity so no one could stay there - they were really nice and set up a water taxi accommodation for all the guests and arrangements to stay at the Boscolo dei Dogi. I think originally the Bellini was slightly more expensive but similar price point - but technically the Boscolo is a "5-star" and the Bellini is a "4-star". I would have to say, as everyone does, in the US we would not classify either of these as a 4 or 5 star hotel - probably close to a 3-star, however, as everyone knows in Italy is a bit different. A true 5-star is probably the Danieli but that is around EUR800 a night! The lobby at the hotel is nice and welcoming, and open - the back opens up to the outdoor area in the garden where there are tables for dining. There is a restaurant (we did not eat there) and a bar in the lobby as well. This is the nicest part of the hotel. The rooms are alright. We had a problem with mosquitos every day - and got bit up pretty bad. The breakfast was a good selection. The staff were not too helpful overall, although were able to get us a reservation at a restaurant that was apparently difficult to get (we witnessed people being turned away when were were eating - which was strange because there were 3-4 empty tables and no one ended up coming to fill them!). Overall probably a good choice for your money - its about a 10-12 minute walk from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, pity about the appalling service”
Reviews.Author: bstuart
Reviews.Content: A fantastic building and gardens in a beautifully quiet yet convenient part of Venice. However the service is appalling for The service was appalling and not fit for any hotel let alone one which claims be 5 star! The safe didn't operate, nobody came to fix it. Chamber maids handed towels to us the door. No complimentary water. One tiny piece of soap. A television that should be in a museum. Not once in 4 days did the door staff, when they were around, or any if the desk staff greet us. T

Reviews.Title: “Falling apart”
Reviews.Author: Jwilliam64
Reviews.Content: Could have been a 5 stars hotel, but reasonably should be a 3 stars hotel. Service is mediocre and facilities definitely need a renovation. Plus it is far away from everything. I don't want to waste my time any further talking about this, which was a total let down for us. Fortunately we were in Venice and we spent most of the time outside enjoying this incredible city.

Reviews.Title: “3 star Hotel with 7 star prices!”
Reviews.Author: act004
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife have just returned from a 3 night stay at the dei dogi, the hotel itself is situated a little off the beaten track approx 20min walk from st marks square but this suited u's fine. Upon arrival the we were checked in promptly and presented with a map of Venice which was explained and quickest routes to various attractions highlighted. Our room was a superior room situated at the back of the hotel by the hotel pier, I'm not sure what made the room superior but my mind wondered if this was a superior room then I would not like to stay in the standard ones, the sound proofing was appalling, the couple in the room above us were very athletic and loud of an evening this lack of sound proofing left little to the imagination so beware! The prices in the hotel are an absolute rip off! Breakfast 30 euro a head and not worth it at all, a beer is 7euros as are soft drinks, the same beer in a larger bottle can be purchased at the piazza Roma for 1.15euros in the supermarket, A bottle of wine was 40euros again the same wine less than 6 euro a bottle in the supermarket! Venice itself is a beautiful city but spoilt by astronomically rip of prices for substandard service, we ate out every evening at different resteraunts leaving each time over 100euros lighter in the pocket and feeling ripped off, to sum the hotel up all I can say is 3 star at best with obscene prices, expensive you can handle but damn right rip off is another thing,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and good facilities”
Reviews.Author: kjeldlisby
Reviews.Content: Dei Dogei is ideally placed when arriving from Marco Polo - Orange Line Waterbus has it first arrivel point only 100 meter from the hotel. The Hotel is clean and the sorroundings - especially the garden, are very peaceful in a hectic city. The staff very helpful - only one little lady at the front-desk - was arrogant and the arrogance was a bad way of trying to hide she was incapable to make the job - a reservation to a concert - the next took over in an effective and smiling way. rgds danish visitors

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but get your walking shoes on.....”
Reviews.Author: vanessa1Derby_Uk
Reviews.Content: Travelled to this hotel for 25th wedding anniversary. Booked a deluxe room and it was lovely, bathroom stylish but shower leaked water everywhere and bathroom was awash at times...if you do not have breakfast included in the price do not bother with it...at 30 euros per person totally overpriced and inadequate. This applies to rest of hotel amenities, ie bar, minibar and restaurant even allowing for the fact that Venice is expensive. Took us 40 minutes to walk to St Marks Square but we enjoyed the walk as everywhere you went there was always something to look at.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, cannot fault it!”
Reviews.Author: MissALondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights beginning on Feb 15th. We just booked a standard room but on arrival were upgraded to a suite. I have never seen such a grand room, clean, huge and very beautiful! We were on the top floor and had a lovely view over the garden and lagoon below. The man who greeted us on reception was really helpful, giving us a map and explaining where to go and how to get there. The hotel itself is situated away from the main sites but it's a lovely walk and if you want to get the water bus there are two stops situated between 5 and 10 mins away. Breakfast at the hotel was included in our package and was great lots to choose from, but at 30 euros (if you don't have it included) I would say it's expensive! All in all would stay here again and would recommend to all!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Dei Dogi”
Reviews.Author: JoshSara
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Dei Dogi which is meant to be a five star hotel and were not very satisfied with it. After booking through expedia we thought breakfast was included as it specified the hotel as a bed and breakfast. However, on arrival we were told this was not the case and found out the prices for food in the hotel was extremely overpriced. A couple of the male receptionists were very nice and friendly and made every effort to make our trip enjoyable, and overall I would say without them the hotel would be a very uninviting place to stay. Other staff were not bothered and quite rude at times like when our room door was knocked on four times by the maid and wouldn't take no for the answer. Both the sauna and the jacuzzi were not working and the shower was cold. Overall I feel you do not get what you pay for, the bar prices are astronomical and I would never stay there again. Venice city itself is very nice and if you enjoy walking you can see the whole of the city in a day on foot. St Marks square is very pretty and definately worth seeing. Eating out in venice can be very expensive, with half bottles of wine starting from 24 euros in some restaurants so be careful what you order.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, our least favorite hotel from our trip to Italy”
Reviews.Author: Frisco_Fred
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Boscolo dei Dogi from New Year's Eve through January 2nd, 2011. We had selected this hotel from several options available through American Airlines Vacations when we booked our holiday trip to Rome, Florence and Venice. The reviews were mixed, but since most complaints centered on insufficient air conditioning during the hot summer months, we figured this would not be a problem at New Years. Unfortunately, while the hotel was acceptable, we concluded it was overpriced and certainly our least favorite hotel of the trip. We traveled with our 3 daughters, ages 14, 12 and 9, and had two rooms on the 2nd floor. Obviously New Year's Eve is a challenging day to arrive. The hotel had a large function downstairs, and we had no reason to be upset by the noise from the band and large dinner crowd. Frankly it was fun for our children to watch the fancily-dressed guests. The major issues we had with this hotel were: - poor heating in the lobby and downstairs area. It was frankly freezing inside the reception area. - unexpected charges. About one hour after we arrived, a room service person arrived with tea and cookies at our door. We had not ordered this. We assumed it was a complimentary welcome service - a nice touch! Then 30 minutes later, after we had enjoyed it, another room service attendant showed up with the bill for me to sign. I did not feel like arguing with him about it after a long day of travelling. - expensive breakfast. The breakfast buffet was E35pp. Overpriced for a meal of lower quality than I would find at Denny's in the States. - inconvenient location. I suppose being on the lagoon side would be convenient for some (it's a straight shot on the boat to Marco Polo International Airport), and it's away from the crowds in summer. But it's a long way from the major sites. The walk to the Jewish Ghetto is only a few canal bridges away, but St. Mark's Square is a good 30 minutes' walk. We knew this going in, but in retrospect wish we had found a more convenient hotel. - expensive. This was the only 5-star property we stayed in on this trip, and it was the poorest quality experience. We felt nickle-and-dimed, and definitely did not feel like we had a 5-star experience in the least. I've stayed at many of the Leading Hotels of the World, and can appreciate real 5-star service. But I wasn't feeling it here. So, in short, if you know what you are getting in to, have a reason to stay in this area, are visiting during a moderatet temperature season, and want to spend this kind of money, it's a fine hotel. Otherwise, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “a beautiful hotel in a precious city!”
Reviews.Author: ladysalUk
Reviews.Content: on arriving at the hotel we were greeted to a very high standard we had the most warmest welcome! We were then offered a free upgrade to the presidential suite which was amazing what a fantastic suite! Our bags were taken from us a delivered to the room very promptly! As we had two teenagers with us they quickly put up another double bed downstairs for them! This suite had the most amazing views over the lagoon and was very peaceful with great black-out blinds that worked with just a push of a button! We thought this hotel was in a great location as we like to walk and by staying here you can amble away into st marks sqaure and you see so much on the way well everything infact! whereby if we stayed in st marks sqaure i dont think we would of seen half as much! We thought it was nice to come away from the hussle and bussle of the main part! There are plenty of fantastic resturants nearby the hotel i will gladly recommend them to you if you wish! Yes the hotel is rather pricey for breakfast at 30 euros ahead which is abit steep and the drinks to are rather expensive but there is a local supermarket very close!!!!!! To eat in the resturant prices are simular to what other resturants are nearby! We celebrated new year in venice which was lovely! This is one of the most magical & romantic cities i have ever been to and i have been to alot! everyone must visit venice in their lifetime its such a precious place and the people are lovely! the staff in the hotel were very friendly and couldnt do enough for us so thank you del doggi and venice for a lovely time in venice and we hope to come back and visit you again! Ciao Bella!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5* Hotel - although 7* prices”
Reviews.Author: visnadi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a way away from the main parts and is on the north of the island - appears to be more residential - less busy - more local restaurants. It is a bit of a walk to the Rialto - even though this hotel was described as a 'few steps away' - and more to st marks sq - although all in all this wasn't really a problem. On arrival at the hotel - the reception area is very beautiful - the receptionist was very nice and bags were taken to the room - the room was quite nice - but extremely tiny - when we had pushed the boat out for a superior double - it had the feel that two rooms had been cut in half with a partition - certainly not what we expected or payed for - as we did not decide to do venice on a tight budget. Unless you are loaded - then dont bother to eat or drink in the hotel. Breakfast is 30 Euro's per person per day. Examples of room service prices: Tea / Coffee = 16 Euro, Toast and Jam 14 Euro, Freshly sliced fruit = 17 Euro. Snacks were priced around 45 Euro mark. The flooding (occuring twice while we were there - and flooding the hotel reception floor by about a foot) was an excuse for hotel staff to try and sell us hotel wellies. Why is this hotel not prepared like the others - when the floods come - put the barriers over the bottom of the doors instead of opening the doors and allowing the water to flow in! Overall - Most of the staff were friendly - the person who checked us out however, was not particularly nice - didnt even ask if we had had a nice stay or wish us a nice onward journey - didn't even say good bye! I wouldnt recommend this hotel to others - it is overpriced for what it is. I would stay nearer to rialto / st marks or academia - the latter being probably where i would stay if i retuned. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel on north side of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Vegas_Odyssey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights in early October while we were traveling around Italy on a bus tour (Globus - Best of Italy tour). The location of the hotel is on the north side of Venice. Its about a 30 minute walk to St Mark's Square. We thought the hotel was very nice. Our room was located on the 4th floor and was enormous. We had a very comfortable king size bed, a large seating area with two chairs and a couch, and a balcony that overlooked the canal in front of the hotel. The room was equiped with an air conditioner but it didn't seem to work (we think they turned it off since the temperature outside was moderate and a/c wasn't necessary). The room had an amazing murano glass chandelier, and a decent flat panel tv (although there were only a couple of channels in english). The bathroom was large and had nice bath robes and slippers. Since we were traveling with a tour group, we got to see some of the other rooms in the hotel. Every room we saw was different being unique in shape, size, and decor. All the rooms we saw on the 4th floor were nice size and elegant, with our room being the largest. One of the rooms we saw on the 2nd floor was tiny! Being an old palace you may end up staying in the King's room or a servants! We didn't try the restaurant at this hotel and had limited interaction with the staff so we cannot comment on that. Overall our stay was pleasant, the room was grand, and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Listen to the reviews......”
Reviews.Author: JJM2207
Reviews.Content: So we just stayed here and for EVERYTHING it was a great hotel. Great staff, beautiful interior, beautiful exterior, beautiful garden, bar,decor...... I read the reviews about the AC and thought since I was booking for September it would not be bad. But it was horrible, and you don't want to open your windows because they are big openings... the air is hot and still. Can sure make the trip miserable. The next time, I would stay in one of the hotels closer to St. Marks. I saw the Aqua Palace on here and then it was booked but I went in and it was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Junior Suite”
Reviews.Author: Ronni68
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were upgraded from a Deluxe Room to a Junior Suite and were very surprised! A private elevator, bedroom, lounge room, sitting area, dining area and huge bathroom with shower and bath, double hand-basins and bidet. After locating the aircon it was sufficient, not great, but definitely took the discomfort from the air and made it easy to sleep. We were so happy with our little abode that we had room service for dinner, it was a great meal. Breakfast was in the outside gazebo with water fountains trickling, the food was standard but the atmosphere was great (coffee was foul). I overheard some people complaining about a toilet running all night, but we had no complaints at all. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Dei Dogi”
Reviews.Author: mvitenas
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I was quite concerned about booking this hotel for our stay in Venice. The reviews that I read prior my trip had me wondering about the quality of the hotel and most importantly - air conditioning. By european standards, I think the Hotel Dei Dogi is one of the nicest. It is not the Ritz but then I didn't want to pay for the Ritz. Yes, it is away from the tourist area - But we didn't want to stay in a tourist area. We walked to St. Mark's square or took water taxis. You will find that the hotel is clean and inviting, and the grounds are beautiful. Breakfast is served on a covered, outdoor patio. The food was good and the atmosphere was great. The rooms were small by american standards but nicely appointed. The air conditioning was enough to make the room comfortable especially in the evening after the sun went down. Electrical outlets were sufficient. As for the staff, I found them most accommodating and willing to help with sightseeing and dinner recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller150765
Reviews.Content: We have travelled a lot and stay in good hotels but this hotel was unbelievable bad. For a 5 star hotel the service was terriblwe. 40 degrees and no airconditioning and no action at all from the hotel staff to make any effort. No suttle bus to the San marco as promissed. Breakfast at a 3 star standard. Do not order room service and think you will get what is in the folder, forget it. Eur 20,00 for a plain toast. After complains not even one single reaction. This should not be a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Boscolo Dei Dogi, Venice”
Reviews.Author: Hermani
Reviews.Content: This olf palace reconverted in an hotel is away from the piazza San Marco and Grand Canale circus, on the NE directly on the Grand lagoon. Beautiful reception, services was impccable; the suite was large and very comfortable as well as very quiet. This hotel owns the largest private gardens in Venice in which one will have breakfast . There is also a portion of the garden with chaise longues to relax on the way to a private dock from which an elegant private boat drove us to piazza San Marco. A great rerteat away from the noise and crowds of Vemice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quiet location - poor air con/service mean it is overated”
Reviews.Author: LondonMarkieuk
Reviews.Content: We loved the location in a quiet part of town, with good local bars/restaurants. The local vaporetto stop (Madonna Dell Otto) also had a convenient and cool water bus direct to/from the airport (Arancia line â‚¬13 each way) The hotel itself looks good but our standard room was smaller than expected, air con was inadequate (so had disturbed sleep in the heat) and service OK but nothing special. More of a 3.5 star than a luxury hotel as claimed. Oh , and drinks prices were very high so go local .

Reviews.Title: “No A/C!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lmhTorrance_CA
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel BUT there is litle to no working A/C and in July, Venice is sweltering. Therefore you won't be able to sleep and if you open the windows, mosquitos will come in and eat you alive. (I had over 30 bites in one night). Message to the owners: Fix the A/C!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with inadequate a/c”
Reviews.Author: godawgsfah
Reviews.Content: The Boscolo dei Dogi was the final hotel in our 10 day, three city visit to Italy. It is away from the main tourist areas near St. Mark's square (30 min walk) which was fine with us and which made the area around the hotel very relaxing and peaceful. The hotel and grounds are beautiful and well maintained. They have a wonderful private wooden boat which takes you to St Marks square and over to Murano island (fun, but the glass salesmen are very persistent). Very relaxing and fun way to get around! The rooms are large and have comfortable beds and reasonably sized baths (especially for Italy). The onsite restaurant was very good, but almost abandoned (except breakfast) when we were there. The recommendations for dining by the front desk were excellent as well. My only real complaint was the poor airconditioning in the rooms. I understand that this is Italy and not the US and that this is a old building with limited room for ductwork and such, but it was really hot (85 d. F at least) in the bedrooms of both rooms we rented. We thought it was broken, but was informed that this "was typical of the airconditioning here" and there was nothing they could do about it. No fans were available and opening the windows just let in even more humid air with mosquitoes. This is a very expensive hotel and a few euros spent on fans for the guests would have gone along way in making our stay more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, though the rooms could be better”
Reviews.Author: Pixie1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Dei Dogi for 3 nights. It's a lovely hotel, conveniently located within walking distance from the city's main attractions but away from the hustle and bustle of the rousit crowds. The only problem we had was the air conditioning. It was too noisy and we had to turn it off at night in order to be able to sleep. Other than that we were generally very pleased with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not willing to refund their error”
Reviews.Author: Wayneloudon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nights at the dei dogi hotel and found it quite hospitable at the time. After checking out in a hurry to catch a train we were accidentally double charged, on returning to australia we contacted the hotel who admitted to the mistake, however it has now been 6 months and after several weak excuses we still have not been refunded and now have stopped receiving replies to our queries! This is not what would be expected from a five star hotel

Reviews.Title: “It stinks”
Reviews.Author: bebeep
Reviews.Content: Really, the fumes coming out of the drains in the bathroom were wretched. When we complained they added an extremely oppressive "room freshner" to the bathroom. The whole situation began when we were assigned to a tiny room whose airconditioner and TV didn't work. So we asked for a change and got it to a similar one whose AC still didn't work (in May) and the TV had heavy snow. By this time we were tired of changing rooms and it was only the next day that we smelled the fumes in the bathroom. We lived with that and the window open and bugs coming in for 3 more nights. As to room size, don't believe tthose pictures, notice they only show the suite rooms. Ours had nice bunch of pillows on the bed but if you tossed them on the floor there was no room left to walk except over them. Also no room to leave a suitcase open. Yea, I know European rooms are tiny but this was really bad. While beds slept well and as others have said the garden and chandaliers were lovely, those were only things you looked at for a few minutes. I get hotel rooms to sleep and relax in. Having a chair in it would have been nice. No AC, TV, bugs and sewer smells aren't even 3 star quality. Others are right about the lack of resturant space and the breakfast when we were there wasn't crowded because we could go to the garden but it wasn't tasty, again, I ate yogurt and cereal and small piece of bread. Better is expected at the price. Staff OK but not really helpful. The halls, carpets all were tired and worn with beat up walls. They and rooms needed fresh paint. Location while quiet really is a long way from places you want to visit. When you set out in the morning don't plan to come back to hotel until you're exhausted. It takes too long to come and go whether by foot or vapporetti-we did both.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service in exquisite site”
Reviews.Author: newhamp99
Reviews.Content: Unable to get room safe to work despite notifying management...gave up trying. Television and internet not working during our stay...seems to be a chronic complaint based on prior reviews. Not 5-star service.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed review for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paula S
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located in a quieter location away from the main attractions, beside a canal. Cheapest way (and most scenic) to get to this hotel is to buy both landbus and waterbus tickets from the kiosk at the airport, which is immediately left through arrival doors. Take the land bus to Piazzale Roma which is the main bus terminal for Venice and cost 3 Euros per person, then take the water bus which is alongside the bus depot on the canal, either No 42 or 52 to ORTO. (The stop is actually Madonna d'el Orto, but everyone calls its ORTO). Be ready at the exit of the boat on arrival, as they qiuckly let people off first, then passengers on, and then they GO! There is no hanging around and you will miss your stop if you are too slow. The water bus tickets are various prices, you can buy a one-trip ticket for 6.50 Euros, or a 12-hour, 24-hour or 36 hour pass. On arrival, to the right of the Orto stop, you will see the back of the hotel awning (no access, only for boat). Walk in a straightish direction, through the buildings facing the bus stop, until you reach a small canal, entrance to hotel is on right. Its only about 4 mins walk. You definately need a map to get around in Venice, the hotel give you one on arrival if you don't have one. You also need the water bus route map. With regards to this hotel, it is beautiful on entrance, the receptionist was very helpful, the gardens are lovely and super to sit in and sunbathe. The bathrooms are superb and the beds are large and comfortable. The bar service we had was first class. The hotel have a complimentary water taxi to St Marks Square, which is really useful, although its only about 20 mins to walk to the main sites, which is fine, as Venice is so beautiful. BUT there are a few issues we found with this hotel - firstly it is very expensive to eat or drink in the hotel (and has to be said, Venice itself). A Gin & Tonic in the bar cost 16 Euros. 4 drinks set us back 53 Euros. The breakfast service was appalling. The food is not much better. Because it is winter, they were not using their outside breakfast area and crammed tables into a small room, which meant standing for 10 mins. waiting for a table in the morning. The breakfast staff are unhelpful and stressed. Coffee was served to us at the end of our breakfast, which was annoying. The cooked breakfast quality is poor. The scrambled eggs are powdered, we think. Awful. Everyone was eating the croissants/rolls and cereal, which says it all. So major thumbs down for breakfast, def. not 4 star! The bathrooms, whilst lovely, with complimentary top-quality shampoo/bath salts/moisturiser etc. bath robes and slippers - had a really weak shower, which dribbled out at best and left you feeling rather annoyed in such a wonderful setting! We had two rooms at the garden end, one was fine, the other was really dark and gloomy. Walls are thin - beware! With regards to Venice itself - what we can we say - Magical. Amazing, Beautiful. Expensive. Bring a big wallet. Bring lots of different layers, as it was 20 degrees one minute, and chilly another, as there is so much shade from the buildings and narrow alleys. We went to the Opera (booked beforehand- Venice Opera House). Loved St Marks, Basilica (free entry) Palazzo Ducale, Bridge of Sighs, Rialto bridge, Accadamia, gondola ride - Â£120 Euros for 45 mins) if you do this- pick up a gondola away from the main St Marks/Rialto area, as you can get the same ride from the Rialto from the water bus and the gondolas get buffeted around by the water traffic, so ask them to take you somewhere on the quieter, meandering back-street canals, its wonderful. Would we come back - definitely, if we can save enough money. They fleece you with a smile in this city, but its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fabulous , great hotel to stay in”
Reviews.Author: GillianWrexham
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault this hotel. Easy reach from airport.Take the 'orange line' from the airport ...its the 1st stop called (Madonna del) ORTO cost is 16 euros per person + 1 euro per bag ...takes aprox 30 min and leaves once an hour 9 am till 11.30 pm ish You can also get a bi=us from airport ...about 6 euros to Piazzale Roma, and then catch a vaporetto to Madonna Del Orta. but you dont save any money really and it takes quite a bit longer ! its approx 5/10 mins walk to hotel from the vaporetto. The hotel ...what an entrance hall....Our room was huge , we went with Airmiles and had a free Deluxe room upgrade. Didnt eat in hotel , but breakfasts were fine.Hotel staff were all great , couldnt do enough for us ! Approx 30 min walk to St Mark's square ...but no problem as such an interesting walk through 'real ' Venice ....lots of bars. eateries and shops on the way. All room ammenities , we had a bottle of champagne which was really nice for 40 euros on arrival in our room. This hotel has a lovely garden which is worth exploring. The vaporetto usually provided foc to St Marks Square was not available ...said it was broken ....dont know if this is for good ...or just that week ; it still didnt spoil anything as the weather was great for mid march...cold but dry and sunny The hotel do provide foc water boat to Murano which leaves every hour. Dont try and follow the hotel map though ...get your own before your journey as many streets are not marked and we got hoplessly lost at nightime when we tried to find our way back to the hotel... We would really recommend this hotel ...ok its a bit of a way out ...but you see a lot of Venice that you would have missed !

Reviews.Title: “lovely venice”
Reviews.Author: iwonder_9
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the hussle of St. Marks but this hotel is away from it all and the quiet was a nice retreat away from rush of carnival Room very nice spacious and lovely bathroom

Reviews.Title: “away from crowd”
Reviews.Author: gigleyLondon
Reviews.Content: main point is the location away from the busy part of Venice, you can arrive by boat from the airport crossing the Laguna;this is a very nice way to discover this amaizing town. easy and quick access to San Marco. Nice lobby and reception, room was ok, breakfast could be improved

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but covenient location. Service was excellent and the room was very nice. Would gladly stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Nellos
Reviews.Content: To start you hop on the vapareto (water bus) at the airport and in less than 30 minutes you are at 'Orto' which is a 4 minute walk from the hotel- very convenient. The room we were initially allocated was on the small side but the staff happily switched us to a slightly larger room. The room was modern ventian style, new, clean and well maintained- twin sinks in the bathroom which was also nice and spacious. Breakfast was great and the service was very good. We had a few special requests and the staff went out of their way to be helpful. 30 minute walk from St. Marco but all through the beautiful bustling alliways- the hotel offers a complimentary boat servce to St. Marco but who needs it if you can walk! Hotel is right next to the Getto so if you are looking for a synagouge etc it is very well located.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: OxfordJoan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is out of the tourist area and the vaporetti are not as frequent as on the Grand Canal or St Marks, but almost all the famous sights are within easy walking distance. Our room was beautifully equipped and very comfortable and we could not understand why there were unfavourable reviews. The garden is beautifully laid out and maintained. On the negative side, the restaurant was deserted and the menu expensive and our bar bill was astronomic - we paid 35 euros for one gin and two tonics - much dearer than St Mark's Square. There were no nibbles - provided in even the simplest bars around town.

Reviews.Title: “Like the rest of Venice!”
Reviews.Author: ishouldbedancing
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet residential location which compared to the centre is charming. It is no problem being outside trhe centre as you walk miles and get lost a lot while you are there. To get to St Mark's is pretty simple. The beautiful Riva boat is free and they do have a timetable that you should be given on arrival. It was good enough but not four star and the general Venitian attitude to service is, well - they don't give any. The whole city is trading on it's past which admittedly has produced something amazing, but don't expect them to be pleased to see you or grateful for your business. It is also very expensive for pretty mediocre food.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful wedding at a top class hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kristalru
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding at the Dei Dogi in August this year and it was wonderful! So where to start! Food - oh the food - it really was amazing. We had 35 guests and all of the 7!!! courses were splendid, they really did us proud. Everyone is still raving about how good it was! Rooms- what can I say we really were spoilt rotten here. We were treated as part of our wedding package to the Presidential Suite at the hotel. This really was a once in a lifetime experience and the room has surely housed some major celebs in it's time. Me and my husband felt like film stars! This room had x2 bathrooms and before my wedding I treated myself to a 35 minute in room spa in the Jacuzzi - wonderful! The morning after our wedding we watched the sunrise over the Venice lagoon and the mountain range in the distance - AMAZING! Staff - they really were lovely and despite what some people say about Italian hospitality I cannot fault them. My brother is in the Navy and wore his formal uniform to the wedding, the staff treated him with a great deal of respect and it was truly lovely of them. I felt for the whole 2 days I was there that the staff treated me like a princess - carrying my wedding dress and bags from room to room with great care and attention. Would I recommend this hotel - in a heart beat! They made our wedding day like a fairytale!

Reviews.Title: “Elegance Personified”
Reviews.Author: Jacarandar
Reviews.Content: The hotel has beautiful grounds and the rooms were large. The location is a reasonable distance from San Marco however they provide a private boat to the square and back many times during the day which helps. We got a very cheap deal which made it good value but not sure if it would be at full price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: harryh2
Reviews.Content: We have just spent five nights in Venice and stayed at this hotel. We didn't arrive til late evening but it made no difference - the guy on reception was very helpful and made us feel welcome. The hotel is in a very quiet part of Venice, but still only a 15/20 minute casual stroll away from the main sights. Breakfast was taken in a marquee in the garden and there was a wide choice of food available - sausage, bacon, scambled egg, cereals, fruit, cold meats, cheese, yoghurts, rolls etc. Our room was very comfortable and air-conditioned. It was cleaned to a very high standard and had everyhting we needed, including TV, mini bar, hair dryer, robes, carpet slippers and a safe in the wardrobe. The rear walled garden was spectacular and a great place to chill out after a day's sightseeing. And at night, the multi-coloured lighting gave it a very special effect. If you are looking for a quiet, relaxing hotel that's a little off the beaten track, and you want to see some of the 'real Venice', then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel1956
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in August and liked the hotel and the area it is located in. It is away from crazy St Mark's area but within 15-20 minutes walk of the station and has restaurants within 5 - 10 minute walk. Hotels provides water transport to St Mark's Square and there is a water bus stop within 5 minutes walk rom hotel. From there you can get to Lido, Murano and St Mark's Square. Hotel is beside a quiet canal and has beautiful garden to the rear that stretches back to the lagoon. Breakfast can be taken in the garden and there was a good choice provided. Staff speak good Engliush and are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: haplo888
Reviews.Content: Having stayed throughout Italy for a 4 week honeymoon prior to staying at the Dei Dogi, we were well versed with the Italian casual attitude towards service, but were hoping to stay some place special for our final nights. Dei Dogi was our worst experience. As common in Italy, everything seemed to be broken or closed, including their internet and spa. Even when we had an appointment at the Spa they closed it anyway because the lady wanted to go home. Much worse, housekeeping entered our room despite our Do Not Disturb sign and threw out my bride's dried roses from Rome and our wine bottle from our Tuscany wine tasting that we drank on our gondola ride the previous night. When we complained, the lax staff offered nothing but an apology. They didn't even help us with our luggage when we arrived by water taxi and their location is poor. The room was pleasant though. We are going back to Venice for our 1 year anniversary and will not be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “A huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel321
Reviews.Content: This place was awful. The air conditioning did not work. There were mosquitos flying around in the room at night. The hotel is not centrally located. The staff is untrained--for example, we were told that the gym around the corner accepts hotel guests. Upon arrival at the gym, we were told that the gym does not have any realtionship with the hotel. We asked directions to the casino at the front desk--they gave us directions, but failed to tell us that jackets were required, so we had to walk all the way back to the hotel so the men could get their jackets. The people at the front desk also call cabs that are twice the price than if you call them yourself. It wa a huge disappointment and a rip off. If you are planning a trip to Venice, stay closer to St. Mark's. Don't let the pictures of this hotel fool you. They fooled me and we paid dearly for it.

Reviews.Title: “Grand and Elegant reception but the rooms could be better”
Reviews.Author: Lil-Mushy-Pea
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after receiving an email notification of a special reduced rate offer â€“ after looking at the photoâ€™s on the website we were expecting something amazing â€“ our room was comfortable but I felt it was a bit small and a bit scruffy â€“ the furniture and bathroom were of adequate standard but nothing like the luxurious rooms portrayed on the website. Had I been in a worse frame of mind I may have asked for a better room, but as we did not spend too much time in our rooms and just wanted to get out and enjoy Venice, I didnâ€™t feel the need to complain. The hotel reception was very grand, the breakfast room elegant and tasteful and the gardens a hidden treat, which would be lovely in the summer. We did not try the spa or restaurant, but neither looked very big, the breakfast buffet had a good choice and was very tasty served until 10.30. The bar was very small and not very inviting as the chairs were placed around the outside of the room around and so did not feel cosy or intimate. The reception staff were very helpful and friendly and we were offered a complementary free drink in the bar on arrival. The location was quite far out from the hubbub of Venice which also meant it was peaceful and quiet. They seemed to have a hotel (taxi) boat but it was never offered to us so I am not sure whether or not it was complementary. Venice was amazing â€“ it was Carnival time and although there was a good atmosphere the streets were so busy you could hardly move in some places. The costumes and masks were good fun and I would have liked to have gone to a ball! I would recommend this hotel but would suggest that you upgrade to a deluxe room if it is for a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GerardJan
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time at this hotel. The staff was very professional and friendly. I would advise this place to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff, but not exactly 5 star.”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl521
Reviews.Content: The Boscolo Dei Dogi is a lovely, out of the way hotel. I cannot say enough about its Canareggio location - perfect! To truly enjoy Venice, you must do so on foot. Venice is the quintessential walking city. That being said, I preferred being a 20 minute walk from the madness of St. Mark's. If you insist on water transport, there is public transportation (very easy!) that drops you off about 5 minutes from the hotel. Now, is this a true 5 star hotel? Not in my opinion. I would place this hotel at 4 stars, not 5. Yes, I know this is Europe, but if you are looking for a true 5 star experience, I would recommend Hotel Cipriani or one of the other grand hotels. At Boscolo Dei Dogi, you are getting exactly what you pay for. You are charged 4 star prices, not 5. One look at the rates for Cipriani and you will know exactly what I am talking about. However, I would like to note that this fact in no way detracted from my stay. I would certainly return on a future visit. The lobby is lovely, the staff is very friendly and, good heavens, incredibly good-looking. I am very happily married, but I am not blind - yes, the men were model-like. At least when I was there. Our room was spacious and done in typical ornate/overdone Venetian style. Breakfasts in the garden were lovely and walking the beautiful grounds was quite relaxing. The "gym" is a joke...literally two machines in a closet-sized space. I suggest walking around Venice as your preferred method of exercise. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to those seeking a true 4 star experience at 4 star prices.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful, great stay, recommended ...”
Reviews.Author: welshrainbow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the dei Dogi as part of a package, and were very impressed with the standard of accommodation and (particularly) the wonderful, quiet location in the Canareggio. Our room was sparkling clean and very well furnished, and the staff we met polite and helpful. Restaurant and minibar prices were steep - but we found plenty of good local restaurants just a couple of minutes walk away. Being away from the centre of the action was a good thing - it gave us another perspective on Venice, and meant we didn't stay immediately around St Mark's but saw much more of the city.
