It really is the best place in the world to get lost, and being away from the middle increased the chances of getting lost immensely! Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the hotel, and would happily go there again

Reviews.Title: “Ended up here when our planned hotel had a technical fault”
Reviews.Author: StAntonJulie
Reviews.Content: We had booked the Residenza Canargio (no 29 in the popularity list at the time of writing) but on arrival we were told that the hotel had a "technical problem" and we were being moved to another hotel which was 5*. I was disappointed because first impressions of our chosen hotel were very positive. At the Dei Dogi we were given a lovely room on the top floor. It was spacious, no particular view, but the building was very traditional and the big open ceiling space was great. The air-con was very noisy which was a bit of a shame and didn't make the room that cool either!!! Breakfast was fine, big selection of pastries, fruit or English cooked (which I didn't touch). In terms of the types of guests staying, there were a lot of older British folk and the rest were either other European families or larger US tour groups. The room could have been cleaned a little better for my liking (I would have been disappointed if I'd booked a 5*) and the bar was prohibitively expensive, but the location is great if you don't mind walking a bit to the sights. Venice in August is over powering so the quiet of Canaregio is attractive. The boat stop is really close and there was apparently a hotel boat that went directly to St Mark's but we never knew when it left and the staff made no effort to tell us about it. I've read some of the reviews and on reflection the staff were a bit indifferent, but I don't know why. Had no reason to be. Shame, could be excellent, the building is so wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “wedding reception”
Reviews.Author: gath
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our wedding in venice on the 9th Sept, and felt i must write of our FANTASTIC experience of this hotel, We had reservations on holding our reception here after the many negative reviews, and had we listened to them, we would have missed out on an amazing time. The hotel is absolutely beautiful, you only have to look at the photos! and from the moment we went to look at the place we were treated by all the members of the staff in an impeccable manner. The food at our cocktail party alone could have fed you for a week! (and we had 20 guests) and they just kept bringing out more and more! The setting in the garden is just idyllic and a rare find in venice, very peaceful and lovely to stroll around. Our main meal was set out on a beautiful table under the gazebo at the rear of the lobby, overlooking the gardens, again it can only be described as FANTASTIC. the service we received during the meal was first class, all meals arriving at the same time, and any requests that we made were dealt with immediately, (people may be thinking that because it was our wedding we would be on such a high that we wouldnt notice any bad service) however we have been to first class restaurants all over the world, and know good food and believe me this was good food! We have 20 other guests who have not stopped talking about how (yes im going to use the word again ) FANTASTIC the whole experience was. I could go on and on. Just go and experience it for yourself, its a beautiful place, away from the crowds of St Marks, and for those who say its a long way to walk to, your in the wrong city, Venice is for those who want to discover hidden gems.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning garden, pleasant ambience, NO AIR CON”
Reviews.Author: GadaboutSolihull
Reviews.Content: The hotel occupies a long strip of land with water at both ends: the massive north lagoon at the garden end, and a narrow canal at the main entrance. The vaporetto stop 'Orto' (Madonna del Orto) is very nearby, on the lagoon, perhaps 5-10 minutes walk with your luggage - on wheels, I hope!. There is no hotel shuttle service, either from the airport, or to San Marco, despite what you may read in other reviews. The staff were pleasant enough, but not exactly helpful. I needed an adaptor, but was met with shrugged shoulders, 'no can do'. The breakfast area is very pleasing, in a permanent tented gazebo construction in the garden. The breakfasts were adequate, but not really of 5 star quality. The breakfast waitresses were pleasant. The architecture is interesting, with some magnificent first floor salons, in the grand Venetian style. The garden is an absolute delight, with a sizeable ancient ice-house amongst the lush foliage. (The echoes in there were amazing.) Very comfortable sunbeds; idyllic really. So peaceful and relaxing. The Canareggio area is not in the main tourist drag. It is quiet and authentic - Venetians live there; that means no Gondolas or tat stalls, (although these are not far away if that's what you want) The main difficulty we had was that the Air Conditioning does not work; as we were shown our room, it was obvious that it was over heated, and I told the porter that it was too hot (August temperatures must be in the 90s F) I also rang down to reception within the hour to complain that the AC was not working, but it was never fixed. It made plenty of noise, but did not cool the room at all. It was desperately uncomfortable, and we didn't dare open the windows (it was too hot outside anyway) but the mosquitoes would have got in - and they are savage. We requested an electric fan, which arrived quickly, and made it slightly more bearable. The room was small, but adequate. Nice bathroom and toiletries, good bathrobes, excellent towels, changed every day. as were the sheets. If the management do something about the Air Con, this would be a fantastic place to stay. As it is, I could not advise anyone to go there during the hot weather. Sad really, cos this could be a truly wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: 06070tiffany
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in April and was completely disappointed. Firstly, anyone who travels to Europe will know that there is a big difference between a five-star hotel in the USA and a five-star hotel in Europe. For novices, basically most five-star hotels in Europe are equalivalant to a basic four-star hotel in the USA and Canada. As others mentioned the lobby of this hotel is impressive and features beautiful murano glass chandaliers and cozy sitting areas. The lobby definitely commands a fine welcome. I found the registration staff to be typically Italian - polished, good looking and terribly inept not to mention rude. My room looked remotely like the photographs depicted on the hotel's website. Yes, the decor was grand, border line tacky, but small even by European standards. The housekeeping service was inconsistant and shabby. On a positive note, the bar/lounge is great and the service was nice, not excpetional. All in all, would probably not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Luxury”
Reviews.Author: NiceNYer
Reviews.Content: Spacious, quiet and bright in a city where all three are hard to find in combination, this property has consistently impressed us over three visits in as many years. The rooms range from the relatively inexpensive and small (our first stay in one of them featured a view of Madonna del'Orto from the marble bathroom!) to grand, garden suites with original frescoes; all have access to a beautiful garden where an impressive breakfast buffet is served daily. The best feature by far is its isolation in the Cannarregio district, which is peopled by locals, not tourists. The walk to the Rialto Bridge and beyond is only slightly longer than it would be from better known hotels at the center of things to their detriment. Our single dinner here was satisfactory but pricey, and one can do better elsewhere. But consistently gracious service and the rooms, with updated Venetian decor and peaceful garden/water views, set this property apart from even pricier alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “A rapidly sliding hotel - thats downhill by the way”
Reviews.Author: arthurh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel some 5 years ago and found it to be very good. I wont be staying there again after the latest experience. I booked a junior suite and a standard room. On arrival the standard room was also upgraded to a suite, really good first impressions. The main suite was dark and dingy and the 2 beds for the kids were tucked away up some seriously steep stairs on a mezzanine floor. The heat in this area was unbearable and the air conditioning didnt work. There was a crack in the main floor the full width of the room with stone and dust continually coming out of it, therefore walking around barefott was not an option, this was confirmed when on leaving the shower I felt something under my foot. the chambermaid must have dropped a glass and not swept it properly, I had a large piece of glass stuck in my foot! Which brings me onto the bathroom, ok as long as when in shower you are prepared to either be scalded or frozen when the next door bathroom either also has a shower or uses the toilet, its actually just downright dangerous. The courtesy launch was spasmodic, they issued a timetable which seemed to work in one direction but not for return journeys and anyway it all closed down at approx 6pm, just when it would be useful for guests to go and enjoy San Marco in reasonable peace. Despite driver confirming the launch would pick up in san marco at 3.15pm and making our way there, waiting and then phoning hotel, it didnt arrive, we were told that service had been cancelled. Hotel did provide a complimentary taxi to Roma next morning as a gesture. One of the hotel lifts just did its own thing, press 2, go to 2, no doors open and then it returns you to ground floor at quite a rate, quite frightening the first time. The saving grace was we found an exceptional restaurant just around the corner, left out of hotel, first bridge on the right, straight on and its the first restaurant on a corner, best meals I have ever had in Italy!! I complained quietly, I dont feel it was taken seriously, but the staff make you feel you should be grateful for being there anyway, so what would I expect. The manager comes in by hotel launch in a morning, straight in for breakfast, doesnt make himeself known to the guests and even though he was there when I complained obviously didnt feel it was necessary to deem to speak to me. Hopefully hoteliers read these reviews and act on them, somehow in this case I doubt it.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: yaakovyitz
Reviews.Content: TWO THUMBS DOWN!!!!! Avoid Staying here at ANY cost! We paid their exorbitant price of $500/ night. The lobby was nice but thats where it stopped!! We were given a room the size of ur average urinal. Turning on the sink made a racket like a herd of elephants. The other sink adjacent to it had a huge crack running through the basin.We complained to front desk immediately But would have been better off phoning Zimbabwe. They refused to do anything for that night & Only after creating a scene & threatening to dispute the charge did they agree to let us move- The NExt day. We were greeted in the next room with a dead mosquito on the pillow. There were no slippers & only one robe , soap, and shampoo- not enough for two people! Instead of a lock on the bathroom door, there was a hole in its place! The keys to the room didnt work either & the chambermaid had to let us in. There were burned out bulbs in the room. The mini bar was locked. The windows had weather stripping dangling from it & the closet door wouldnt close. We couldnt sit on the toilet straight because there was a step leading down to the bathroom right in front of it! The water pressure was horrible. The air conditioner was VERY noisy. The straw that broke the camels back was when we wanted to shower before we had to head out & there was NO HOT WATER!!! We called the front desk. Their response?- There is hot water and my wife is a liar for saying that there isnt !?! We invited then to come & try it for themselves before telling us that there is but they were too "busy" to accomodate us. What a disaster of a stay!! I would expect more out of a hostel than we got from this "5 star" hotel. We stayed in many cities both throughout Europe & the U.S.- both cheap places and expensive ones- Boscolo Dei Dogi was BY FAR the WORST place out of them all. It really put a damper on an otherwise very enjoyable vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fernandillaardilla
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The staff was really nice. The hotel as a building is beautiful. Is a pleasure to stay in Dei Dogi. It is worth every star. It is romantic and even though is a little far from San Marcos, it is totally worth it. LOVED IT

Reviews.Title: “Unfair reviews?”
Reviews.Author: rdhughes
Reviews.Content: Travelled with Cox & Kings to this hotel and really enjoyed our stay despite a lack of sunshine! The Hotel reception staff were outstandingly helpfull and very freindly indeed. Given how reasonably priced this hotel is, our room was absloutely fine, nice sideways view of its canal, fantastic gardens and the breakfast was fine. We did not have an evening meal as the prices looked pretty steep compared to other restauarants nearby. We would stay there again. Roger

Reviews.Title: “The most romantic location and a fabulous sympathetic renovation”
Reviews.Author: CatK2000
Reviews.Content: The whole atmoshere of Venice in February lends itself to total romance, with less crowds and no unpleasant smells from the water. The weather is below zero which makes the water ethereal and magical. De Dogi is off the beaten track but they provide a water taxi service for guests and the alternative walk to St Mark's Square only takes 20 mins. Wrap up in your furs and enjoy the tranquillity of this quarter of Venice. Leaning out of the balcony on a Sunday morning and only hearing single footsteps and church bells from the street below in what is usually a crowded city was sureal. A city where graffiti was in the shape of red love hearts on a wall says it all......... We loved the anonymity of the jazz bars that were invisible in day light but somehow transformed their frontage at dusk and they became the hub and heartbeat of the night. Try Canneregio on Miserocordia. If you are a musician take your instrument along for an open jamming session at the end of the evening. Indulge in rustic tappas style food and local wine. As you would expect of any large tourist city Venice is full of mediocre tourist restaurants serving middle of the road over priced food and like any tourist sometimes that's OK and serves a purpose but here are many great restaurants if you choose carefully. Try Vesuvio on Lista Di Spangna for authentic food and a great atmosphere. Stay at De Dogi to appreciate fabulous architecture, antique murano chandeliers, marble floors and a hidden walled garden. Boscolo is fast becoming my favourite hotel group........[--]

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: ronenj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on the second weekend of September. The staff was really not friendly especially the people at the reception. The room we stayed in was very small and we had to ask for a connected bed. The breakfast was very poor. The hotel itself is very beautiful however we expected much more for a 300 euro a night hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful - completely dreadful!”
Reviews.Author: darrengibbs
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Grand Hotel Dei Dogi every year bar one (where we stayed at the 5 star Boscolo Aleph in Rome - now that's another sore point!!!!) for the last 6 years and initially we couldn't recommend it more. Our first stay was brilliant - staff were excellent and the whole experience was superb, hence returning year after year. However, nothing ever seems to stay the same nowadays and over the last 6 years the quality of the hotel and especially the service and attitude of staff has waned gradually but this year has plummeted dramatically. I booked this trip in March and as I am a Boscolo Card holder requested at the time of booking, my complimentary free upgrade to the room we stayed in the previous year. I assumed as this was requested 5 months in advance it had been actioned. Nearer the time of travel I sent an email requesting confirmation of this request - no response - then another a few days later - again no response. So, with fingers crossed we travelled. We firstly flew to Rome and stayed in the Regina Baglioni (we normally stay at the Aleph but after dreadful treatment there - is this a trait of the Boscolo group I wonder....). The experience at the Baglioni was fabulous - we have stayed at countless 5 star hotels and this rates up there with the very best. Superb, attentive staff, great room with excellent air con, great service, great location - great everything really. We then flew to Venice to stay at our 'old faithful' Grand Hotel dei Dogi - yes, it had lost it's excellent status over the years, but we were confident it wouldn't slip further - how very wrong we were... We were greeted, AFTER struggling up the step into the hotel by a doorman/porter in bright white Nike trainers! We went to the desk where we were greeted with indifference by the femail receptionist. No warm welcome at all. I asked her if my request for the upgrade had been made to the specified room and she said no, because that room was one grade above the upgrade - so why wasn't I told this 5 months ago or anytime since that booking and the two request for confirmation so I could have done something about it - payed more to secure it? She said the hotel was full anyway so that was that. I was a little annoyed to say the least but kept my composure and accepted we would have to compromise. Not the best of starts. We were shown to our room and it was awful - small, a very low ceiling, windows set at skirting board level and only half way up the wall, ie a nice view of your midriff for those below but no view for you! Obviously we went down to reception and politely requested if it was at all possible to move rooms - the receptionist was ignorant and put out! This got me seiving inside as I had paid Â£750 over 5 months ago (and this was with an early booking, pay in full up front discount!) for three nights room only for this 'service' - a not inconsiderable amount. She just kept tutting and shaking her head and showing she was annoyed with us! I then had just about had enough of this attitude, this lack of respect and service and said we'd be more than happy to leave and I would like a refund. She then said we could have the room originally requested(!) BUT we would need to pay another 200 euros PER NIGHT!!!! Thanks for nothing!!!! I spoke to my wife and said spending another Â£400+ with this hotel was not something I wanted to do so I said no. She then said we could look at another few rooms (I thought they were full?) so, with a heavy heart we agreed. The rooms were in a row - Room one was bad - tiny, dark - no good. Room 2 was only a tiny bit better and a third room was about the same. My wife was getting annoyed so I said room two - bit of a mistake!!! When the porter had gone I went into the bathroom - or should that be shower room!!! Oh dear - my wife likes a bath - me a shower and I assumed all the rooms had a shower over bath set-up but no. I did notice the third room had a bath as the door had been open but hadn't noticed this hadn't as the door had been closed. Yes, my mistake, innocent and understandable I am sure you'd agree. I popped to reception and said appoligetically that we had just realised that the room didn't have a bath and could we move to the third room - well, was she annoyed or what. She huffed and said 'well you didn't ask for a bath, tut,' shake of the head several times!!! There was no, 'No problem sir - certainly you can move to the next room'. A truelly dislikeable, ignorrant, inpolite and rude person as you would ever have the displeasure in meeting. We moved rooms and on closer examination it was shabby, unclean, badly leaking shower screen all over the floors (very dangerous), noisey and ineffective air con, no turndown service (had been every other year), fraying furnishings, dark, noisy - need I go on...) but we were beyond caring - we just got out at every opportunity. On the second night the room beside us was taken and it seemed like a party was going on with at least 4 very raised voices (in a double room - very cosy!) It was like the people were sitting at the foot of our bed! it started a 11.50pm with a huge bang, bang on the nexr door and after much merryment, 2 people left the room at 2am. The 2 people left in the room continued to below at each other until almost 4am! Bad luck I guess... Suffice to say, we will NEVER stay there again. I am sure some people have had reasonable stays there, but take it from me - I've stayed there many times - not like these 'one hit wonders' - 'oh we'll definitely be going back' brigade. It's been sliding for several years but started at such a great height of 5 star luxury and class that it has taken until now to hit rock bottom - and boy has it done that. The Boscolo group need to get their act together as we have had dreadful service the last two times we stayed at the Aleph in Rome to, so this seems to be a serious problem stemming from their choice of employees. Italians are good people but can come across as a little curt - it's just how they are - nothing is meant by it - but the Boscolo staff at the dei Dogi and Aleph take this to a whole new level...I am slicing through my Boscolo Priviledge card as I speak....

Reviews.Title: “Only a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Krissy16250
Reviews.Content: Beautiful 5* hotel sited in a 17th century building fitted throughout with Murano glass light fittings, marbled floors fabulous antique furniture and pretty garden. Situated in a quiet area away from the hustle and bustle of San Marco. That unfornuately is where the good points end! this is at best a good 3* hotel pertaining to be a 5* but has a way to go yet. The prices do not reflect room size (dont be fooled by the advertised junior suite, most rooms are not anywhere near this!), servicing of rooms nor food quality. Great restaurants near by offering better food and value. Breakfast is an extra cost of 22â‚¬ pp worth 12â‚¬ at the most, buffet style with food uncovered and at times stale. Servicing of rooms not a 5* standard. For example our bathroom still had towels from previous occupents, grouting falling from the tiles overnight, mouldy shower screen seals, wine bottle and glasses left in room for 2 days and then left outside on the floor for another 2. Though the staff are extremely polite and helpful service is slow. Online bookers beware as advance payments are not always shown on hotel account we ended up paying twice because payment records could not be found we are now fighting to get our money back

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: TravelBum2007
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel located off the beaten path- but with access to the beaten path. The hotel has periodic shuttles to San Marco region. This area has many cozy restaurants where mostly locals (Italians at least) congregate. Very pleasant staff and beautiful gardens in the back. I've never written a recommendation before- but wanted to give kudos to Dei Dogi.

Reviews.Title: “understated elegance”
Reviews.Author: D44
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful old palazzo that has been converted into a historic and authentique venetian hotel. Our room was large and comfortable. The hotel is elegant, perhaps a little worn around the edges but more than makes up for it with its quiet serene location and a beautiful garden with lagoon view. The free canal boat service several times a day to the Rialto area is another bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful with some small flaws”
Reviews.Author: granville callan
Reviews.Content: It's worth staying at this hotel just for the building. It's like staying in a dolls' house. I went down the stairs from our room on the top floor each day, rather than using the lift, so I could look at the paintings and the chandeliers in the hallways on the first floor. There is a lovely garden, containing, among other things, an old ice house. My partner called this 'The chamber of consonants'. Go inside and say a few words. You will see what she means. The small flaws were so easily fixable that I can't see why the management doesn't just sort them. The staff were very helpful and efficient with the exception of the person on reception when we checked out. She definitely needs a refresher course on dealing with customers politely. The 'American Breakfast' was woeful. I would prefer it if the hotel said 'Ok this is Italy, so you get an Italian breakfast' - Fine, no problem. But, if you are going to charge 22 euros a go for bacon and eggs, you really should find out how to cook them first. One bit of practical advice. To get from the airport to this hotel, don't pay through the nose for a water taxi and don't spend ages taking public transport and walking. Instead take the Alilaguna Linea Arancio (orange line) boat from the airport jetty. It runs every hour, costs 12 euros and takes 35 minutes. You get off at Madonna Dell'Orto, which is just around the corner from the hotel. Walk inland from the jetty, turn right at the canal and the red awning of the Dei Dogi is right in front of you.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic 40th Birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: crazy60
Reviews.Content: Taken to Venice as a surpirse for my 40th Birthday!! It was somewhere I had always wanted to go and it certainly lived up to my expectations. Hotel was recommended to my partner. We found the Hotel to be very nice, the room was lovely, overlooking the lagoon. It was not in the centre, but we knew that, however it was lovely to take the private boat into the town (20 minutes) or to walk only took half an hour (maybe longer if you stopped at all the shops on the way). Didn't eat in the Hotel, we had been recommended a couple of restaurants to eat in. Hotel has a garden, which is unusual in Venice. Staff were very helpful, tea and coffee was lovely, with free nibbles too!!! Gondola was brilliant and not to be missed!! Coffee in the square was expensive, but well worth it. Couldn't have had a better weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: londontravellista
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with lots of veritable pieces of art, located north of Venice. Excellent base if you like quiet surroundings, so you can cross all these little islands that form Venice and reach the touristic locations. Take a fast boat from the airport (quite pricey for Venice) and reach the hotel in 20min. The hotel has its own gardens (was a french embassy some 200 years ago, the only negative thing, our room was located in front of the building, so the hotel's boat would wake us up in the morning. Otherwise, great hotel and they had lots of small things thrown in for us.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Venice Retreat”
Reviews.Author: englishgent65
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. Yes the food and drinks are expensive but we found fabulous eating places close by - family run, full of locals and wonderful food. The hotel was extremely tranquil and relaxing, and the staff were eager to please. The real bonus was the private water taxi which swept us in amazing style to the centre of Venice and back. Although dont miss the opportunity to stroll into the centre one morning..its a wonderful walk. We wanted a magical experience from Venice and we got it. The hotel really played its part in this. When we saw the city centre hustle and bustle we were grateful we chose an elegant, relaxed hotel in a quite, residential area. And yes, there are no kettles in the room..but heh, how often are you in Venice? Crack open the wine!! Enjoy..we did

Reviews.Title: “Far from the crowd, close to the sights”
Reviews.Author: AddictTraveller69
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in Boscolo Dei Dogi for the Easter holidays. We loved the hotel immensely. First, the location is excellent. I know that I managed to see not only the Venetian sights, but the city itself. There were not only tourists, but children running back home from school, old ladies walking with their little dogs, young moms strolling with prams and toddlers. We enjoyed the charm of an old town together with the proximity to Piazza San Marco and other world famous sites. Second, we had a wonderfull chance to try excellent Venetian dishes at the hotel restaurant. The hotel rooms and premises are extremely spacious to the Venetian standards. The hotel has even got its own garden! I would highly recommend Boscolo Dei Dogi to families with older chidren. Our 10-year old daughter loves this place.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tyneen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March for our wedding anniversary and had a wonderful time. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. We loved the hotel's boat which had a regular service to and from St marks square area. Our room was lovely with nice toiletries, we overlooked the canal but didnt have a balcony, just two large windows. We took a travel kettle, tea and coffee on the advice of previous guests reviews, and bought a small carton of milk from the local shop which did us fine. There is a mini bar in the room so we kept the milk in there, we also bought some champagne which was cheap and nice too. It is very easy to walk to and from the hotel into the main sight seeing areas, we really enjoyed this and seemed far quicker than taking the water taxi,s, plus you get the chance to explore the "real Venice." We used the water taxi,s to the Islands of Murano and Buruno which we enjoyed too. Although it was cold and raining when we went to muruno, so didnt stay long. We found a very friendly place to eat which I think was called Malibran, not far from rialto bridge area, staff were great, i think it was a hotel at the back. this made a nice change as we had used the self service places to eat which were advertised as having tourists menu outside, but we found the staff to be rude and over-look us as we wasnt sure how it worked once inside. We left our luggage in the hotel prior to a night flight home and had no problems on return to the hotel with anything missing. We would not hesitate to stay at the hotel again if we returned to venice. However, we would probably choose a hotel nearer the square like the Monaco, only because we have walked the back streets of Venice. We booked this hotel through Asiarooms.com which were very efficient indeed and even emailed us about a week before to remind us we were going!

Reviews.Title: “it was worst hotel i 've ever stayed.....”
Reviews.Author: GenevaMary
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this terrible 5 star ???? hotel just for 2 nights , also have a problems with a dental kits, but its nothing with what happend later... After i packed my lugguage and gave it to reception ,it was the last day, went for a walk, because had a few houres before flight...When i came back to the hotel pick up my staff, i realised that forgot jacket and trousers in a room wardrobe. I told it to reception, they checked room and........didnt find ANYTHING! Than called to person who cleaned my room,and she even said "that saw jacket in my lugguage", probably she was in a room at time i packed or checked my bags after ????? I was so shoked and nearly cry,that this discusting situation happend in a one of the "LUXURY" hotels! One hour later the hotel staff basically admitted the clothes had been stolen by the staff ("We have a problem with the Albanian staff") .I was quite upset & late and my husband phoned the hotel to see if they could transfer me to the airport, but be told "we don't offer that service", which he suggested is contrary to what's on the hotel website. They backtracked & offered to call a taxi, which they never did.That was my first trip to Venice,as you can see VERY romantic,peaceful and nice!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: phillylawyerphila
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend at the end of August and we had an absolutely fantastic time. Our room was lavish and delightful, our arrival romantic and service impeccable and our room just perfect. Bathroom sparklingly clean, well done out and toiletries "gorgeous" (girlfriend's word not mine!). Hotel impressive in its grandur. Garden beautifully romantic. The Prosecco we had waiting for us was chilled perfectly, despite the fact we arrived late due to our delayed flight. The staff were just as great with us throughout, and even posted my girlfriend's diary to us after she left it behind. The area of Cannareggio in which it lies is my favourite part of Venice and ideally suited to a hotel such as this. My one warning would be to check out exactly how the hotel's water taxi operates when you first get there, as it can seem a little erratic. I can't understand some of the more sceptical reviews - perhaps a few isolated bad experiences - it was all I'd have expected and more. I'd definitely stay there again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from hell !!!”
Reviews.Author: JohnGoodman
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel that I have ever seen in my life.The staff is treating their guests so badly, that I would not believe that this was possible if I would not experience this in person.Beware, all the negative reviews about this hotel are absolutely correct.The good ones are probably due the extremely cheap rates that can be found sometimes for this dump...But let me start - from the bad things to the unbelievably bad ones ! I have booked 2 rooms for the week-end,stating clearly that I prefer a high floor.As soon as we arrived around midday,we have been assigned one room on the ground floor and another one on the first floor. Both was in the back of the hotel, in order to get to your room you need to walk pass the breakfast room,trough the luggage deposit, then to the small courtyard where the broken furniture is stored... you get the idea.It feels like this rooms where part of storage rooms before, but has been converted to guest rooms in order to squeeze some more money from this dump.In one of the rooms the bed was not done, in another there was a large stain on the bathroom floor - disgusting.The ground floor room had no windows, the first floor one had 2 very small ones that do not allow any light in the room.When I have asked for another room the front-desk staff nearly laughed in my face ! Them said that the hotel was full ( difficult to believe at 12 AM ) and that if some of the guests would not show ( !!! ) them would give me a better room.The reason why we where treated like 3-rd order guests was not explained.Just to add more offence, my frequent flyer card witch entitles me to a free upgrade at Boscolo chain was ignored. Ok, I was trying to do not let them to ruin our week-end in Venice and have accepted what we get.We went out of this "hotel" for a walk in the city centre, came back around 22.30, looking for a good rest. I have asked the front deck clerk if a dental kit was available.He told that he will send us one.Nothing arrived.I went out of out room,located the maid and asked her for a dental kit.The answer that I got was : 1 - there are no dental kits available 2 - that she could provide me the toothbrush that them do use for pavement cleaning !!!! She was clearly laughing at me, I was not able to believe my ears!A maid was laughing at guest, in a 5* hotel, after a request of a dental kit !!! I have asked for her name, assuring her that I will inform the management about her attitude - what else I could do ? Went back to my room,and went to the bed strait away looking for a good rest.Has been waken up around 23.00 PM by a very loud music.Called front desk,them put the phone down for 3 times.Insisted,them picked up and told me that there is a wedding going on.I have told them that it was impossible to sleep and the clerk assured me that he would inform the management and find a solution.After an hour I got a call from my friends in the room on the ground flood, the music was getting extremely loud and their 6yo child was crying scared ! I have tried to contact the front desk again,for approx. 20 times - nobody answers.The things was getting worse in the meantime - the music got to the level that it seemed that you are sleeping in the middle of the disco, there was drunk people screaming under my windows,somebody was running in the corridors making unbelievable noise, it seemed that them was trashing the place! Some staff arrived in front of my friends room and started to disassemble some metal furniture - you can imagine how this sounded.Them get out of the room and asked the staff to stop - completely ignored ! At 01.45 I put the closes on, asked my girlfriend to lock her well and got down to the lobby.What I have seen there can not be described.There was HUGE loudspeakers installed, the colour lights and the strobes was on - basically the lobby has been transformed to the disco !!!Lots of drunk people everywhere and so on.I have located the front desk man and asked him to stop this madness.He told me that he can not - he just called the manager and he said that he can not do anything about it too !!!!! So I had to call police... can you believe that ? I was forced to call the police, in order to make a hotel to respect their guests !!!! Police arrived quite fast, forced the front desk guy to turn the music off,called the manager,took his name and told me that this was unbelievable even for them, such an attitude from a hotel to their guests.So here I am - 02.45 in the night, with the police in the lobby of this "5* hotel" and scared 2 women and a child waiting for me in their rooms.Not bad for a relaxing week-end trip,eh?Icould contimue with the offenses that have continued in the morning,but I guess you already have the idea what this place is about.Now I have asked my lawyer to take it from there - this is this biggest offence that I have ever received in a hotel and something should really be done about it - I can imagine other people coming to this place looking for some peace and relax .... and finding the most arrogant, non-caring people in the hotel business to ruin they holidays!

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit and last.”
Reviews.Author: Les666
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel about 5 years ago and had a nice time, revisit this year and it was ok, but good for the money we paid, Â£250 inc BA flight from Gatwick for 3 nights.. via expedia.. BA flight on time in fact early!! meal was an egg roll, YUCK...anyway, when you land and get out of customs go to the desk for local bus ticket ACTV which is at the end of a row next to the car hire booth. only 2 Euros. Coach is available but costs more. On arrival in Venice this hotel is a pain to find and if you go wrong you will walk MILES, so take cases with wheels. In the left corner of the bus area is a GREEN metal bridge, cross this, go passed the railway station on other side of canal which will be on your left, cross on large bridge and get to Ferrovia, ... From here its a simple water bus ride, tickets are at the moment 25 Euros for 3 days, dont forget to validate your ticket in a small yellow box by each main water bus jetty, fail to do this and you will get a fine. Look on map for ORTO. When you get to bus stop keep going south till you hit a canal then turn right, its next to a big church. OK now your in...Buffet breckfast about 22 Euros and not worth it, small cafe along canal better value. Drinks 16 E for rum and coke, 8 E for a bottle of beer..didnt go silly but 6 of us racked up a 350 E bill in 3 nights. Hotel shuttle water bus, goes about every hour and now stops at St Marks Square not the Rialto as before. So what are the rooms like? Upgrade to a superior room for a good sized room, a suite if you can afford it...basic room is well, basic. Free slippers, mini bar, dressing gowns, bath and shower, free soap , shampoo etc etc..Hairdryer, internet point in room but no hotel computer, no coffee making facility. To summerise....Very friendly, good english, very remote, clean, go early in season March onwards, EXPENSIVE unless you get a deal, next time I will stay more central, around the Amadaeus hotel area.

Reviews.Title: “No kettles in room”
Reviews.Author: LouiseScott
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the hotel as a wedding gift from my family. The hotel is positioned in the north of venice so it is away from the crowds but it is still walkable to all the main galleries, st mark's square and the churches. The foyer of the hotel is fairly grand and the murano glass chandeliers are eye catching. However our room was fairly disappointing. There was a tiny window in the room which meant there was hardly any natural light. We could have been in a cellar! The bathroom had crumbs from the previous occupant and was slightly on the small side. There was no bath however we were given bath powders and bubble bath..not sure why! The bed was huge but it did comprise of two twin beds pushed together. Rather strange but comfortable enough. There was a mini bar in the room, vastly expensive prices. However there was no tea or coffee making facilities. If you decide to stay in this hotel take a kettle unless you want to pay 9 Euros. Yes 9 Euros (@Â£6) for an espresso!! Breakfast was not included in our tariff, so budget for it if you decide to eat in the hotel. Overall our room did look rather grand with exposed beams and lots of gold. The bathrobes and tolietries provided were high quality. However there was no little extra touches that you would expect a 5 star hotel to provide. No irons or ironing boards in the room and there was rather a disgusting smell (egg like) in the room on one of the nights. But I guess this is Venice! Overall this hotel provides an average service but it did not impress us enough to want to stay there again. I would not have rated it as a 5 star hotel and was surprised it had been given this rating.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit of Classic Venice”
Reviews.Author: Deadheadexec
Reviews.Content: A cancelled flight and a complete change of trip itinerary led us to a last minute need of an additional night in Venice. We arrived by water taxi in the front of this hotel. We found this hotel met the description of a boutique hotel, our favorite kind in Europe. The lobby was warm and inviting, lavishly decorated with Murano glass lighting, opulent furnishings and a friendly, efficient check in staff. We booked a JR. Suite which stated double bath sinks in the confirmation. We did not receive double sinks but was not disappointed. Our room, 207, faced the canal in front and was actually a 2 floor room. You enter to the one bath and 2 twins/king on first floor with small settee/sitting area, TV armoir, desk. Extremely spacious with lots of floor room. Up a narrow set of stairs from the main bedroom is a loft with 2 twins/king, TV ,armoir. Beds were innerspring mattresses and extremely comfortable for Europe with high end linens. Baths had plush towels, slippers, robes and full size amenities (shampoo, cond., gel,lotion) including a kit with hair band, file, cotton balls, laundry soap, caps etc. Bathtub with shower (yes!) well proportioned for the larger person. Rooms slightly under decorated and could be described as sparse, although I felt it lent to the emphasis of the age of the building and its' architectural features. The breakfast room and the buffet was among the top 3 we have experienced in Europe. Fresh fruits, juices, cereals, breads, pastries, scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs, hams, salamis, bacon,an array of cheeses and all constantly replenished by the friendly staff. Coffee is brought to your table by staff who will take your order. The best part of this hotel is actually outside. Follow through the rectangular shaped lobby to the glass french doors and you will find a large covered patio, likely used for receptions. Pass the patio area is one of the most beautifully maintained gardens we had seen, with statues, water features and paths leading to tunnels. At the far end of the graden on the left are more guest rooms which seem to be in their own small villa building. The front desk staff stated they were Deluxe rooms you must request when making the reservation, the highest category of room in the hotel. You have a front , private garden view and the other side is the lagoon, a water view. At the far end of the garden is a set of iron doors which lead you to the back dock directly on the Venice lagoon. Out these gates we watched rowing teams in the morning fog and boarded the hotel boat, free for guests to Piazza San Marco where they pick you up on schedule to bring you back to the hotel. The boat is beautifully appointed with a closed cabin seating area and uniformed boat captain. Although the hotel boasts a wonderful elegant dinner menu, we were in the mood for a walk and a more casual dinner. Front desk staff not only made a recommendation of a local restaurant but called ahead and gave them our name and asked them to expect us. It was an 8 minute walk from the hotel. We noticed only a few restaurants on our walk so unless you want to venture into Venice by boat for a larger selection, your options will be limited. The food was local fish and pasta dishes as well as Tirumisu and local Venetian cookies for dessert. We watched what the locals were eating and asked questions. We were not disappointed in our selections. We transferred to our next hotel by water taxi arranged by the front desk and were disappointed in having to leave. This hotel was not in the midst of the Venice tourist area but met the need for peace, quiet, tranquility and elegance. We hope to return to Dei Dogi and put this one as one of our Top 5 European Boutique hotels list.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - Fantastic start for our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Julie74
Reviews.Content: The service was wonderful, when they found out it was our honeymoon they sent a bottle of complimentary bubbly to us. The room was lovely with a HUGE bed. Very clean room and bathroom., with gorgeous fluffy bathrobes. Lovely decor and everything worked in the room. The lobby of this hotel is stunning and there is a communal area on each floor which are all decorated with paintings of the old Doges. The hotel is in a residential area of Venice but a short walk over a couple of bridges takes you to a lively area full of shops, resteraunts and bars. The vaporetto stop is a short walk away and very easy even with a suitcase. Would definatley recommend this hotel and would certainly go again myself.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: emma01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have taken 3 nights at the Hotel Dei Dogi in Venice for 2 years running, and are about to make it 3. We go in November, when our own hotel is closed. We love it--the location is perfect, on a quiet canal within interesting walks of great small restaurants, some shopping, some beautiful views and a small church next door with great art. The staff is helpful and friendly. We have never eaten in the hotel restaurant, and do not always take breakfast there, though it is a lovely spread. We feel we are now recognized by some of staff, and it is really "home from home" in Venice for us for 3 glorious nights a year! Our rooms have always been very nice, and beautifully maintained. Margaret Stephenson

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: phillytraveler2
Reviews.Content: The hotel had some good qualities, nice location in a pretty, quite residential area, yet only 5 minute walk from the main street. The also have a free shuttle, nice water taxi, to St. Mark's square several times per day. The hotel also had lovely Etro toilettries. However, the hotel did not match up to other 5 stars I've stayed in. Apparently in italy there is a higher class 5 star L, which this hotel is not. The rooms were not as clean as I would expect with crumbs on the carpet and mildew in the corners of the shower. The room service was also very expensive, with a cup of coffee about 10 E. The turn down service was not sufficient either, they only made the bed, did not straighten up the bathroom or bring fresh towels.

Reviews.Title: “Never again at the Dei Dogi in Venice”
Reviews.Author: FMolieri
Reviews.Content: Last May we stayed at the Dei Dogi Hotel in Venice, Italy. We booked this hotel through Hotels.com and must say that for the great service Hotels.com provides to travelers, it is a shame that establishments such as Dei Dogi that do not meet the high standards they advertise to have make a great dis-service to this great website. Dei Dogi proved to be the complete opposite of all it offers to be in their advertisement. Our experience was terrible, almost ruined the entire visit to Venice. Accomodations were less than adequate, even after upgrading to a suite for 300.00 euros more a day. Very shop-worn and upkept, where the bathroom fixtures did not work properly and took them a day to get them repaired after repeated requests. But certainly the most unexcusable part was the behaviour and attitude of the staff towards hotel guests. They were unfriendly, full of comptempt and extremely rude. In short, we wound up leaving Venice a day earlier than planned just to get out of there and not to have to tolerate such unconsiderate treatment. The difference of being in this suppodedly 5 start hotel became even more negatively accentuated after comparing it to the hotels we stayed at in England and Germany, where it became obvious that the art of running a first-class hotel with impeccable professionalism has not been forgotten as in the case of Dei Dogi. We do not recommend to anyone to stay at this hotel, it is to high a price to pay for such a cheap experience. Regards, Francisco Molieri

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay!”
Reviews.Author: BAJ786
Reviews.Content: We expected an elegant five star hotel with all the amenities. The hotel is very nice; however, there was no air conditioning! We spent four nights swatting mosquitoes as we had to have windows open in the warm weather. Their water taxi shuttle service is convenient, and we liked being away from the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “delightful and quiet”
Reviews.Author: noddie11
Reviews.Content: Having read the other reviews on trip advisor, I was very apprehensive about our recent visit. My husband and I had a long weekend break at the Dei Dogi the weekend before Christmas. We arrived early evening by water taxi from the airport and the concierge was waiting outside in the cold night to take our bags. We had a very pleasant room overlooking the delightful garden.It was well fitted out, clean and much larger than I anticipated. All the staff were helpful, booking us a meal for the first evening and recommending other places for later. All questions asked were corteously answered.We were on a bed and breakfast rate and breakfast was not adventurous but perfectly adequate with pastries, bread, fruit, cheese and meats and also bacon eggs and sausage.We left with the same good impressions we had at the start. A lovely quiet hotel with plenty of nearby restaurants.expensive but this is Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rotten scoundrels”
Reviews.Author: KurtnGirls
Reviews.Content: Over priced and under-delivered. I could go on for pages, but the quick of it is... Dei Dogi staff didn't care enough to make the bed, clean the unit. They charged over $1,000/day for a double room when we were suppose to get a large suite. The staff was suppose to provide access to a business center with internet connection, but this was not available. We called the week before the trip and they lied to us about one thing after another. They are dishonest, over priced and most of all arogent. Terrible location....terrible service..they ruined our trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Get a receipt for your left luggage!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dei Dogi for 2 nights in November. This is a lovely hotel in the quieter Cannaregio district and the complimentary water taxi to the Piazza San Marco makes it an ideal location. Our room was well-appointed, if a bit on the dark side and the bathroom door wouldn't close. Breakfast was mediocre and at 22 Euros a pop, very expensive. The staff were polite and helpful and I would certainly stay here again. However - beware if you need to leave your bags in the hotel's safe-keeping before your flight home. Get a receipt - or something: our bags went missing. After a few anxious telephone calls the concierge located them on a water taxi heading for the airport. How they managed to walk out of the hotel and on to the taxi is a mystery. However, full marks must go to the Dei Dogi for the ingenuity of solving the problem. We left without our bags, met the other taxi mid-lagoon whereupon the bags were transferred to our taxi! Fabulous! Give the Dei Dogi a try.

Reviews.Title: “Average for a 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: beaubrummie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a long weekend in a junior suite. The room was lovely with a welcoming bottle of champagne and biscuits, lovely toiletries in the bathroom, but the view was of the kitchen!!! The hotel is very ornate and has a lovely garden and jetty area which overlooks the water. We dined in the hotel restuarant on our first night and the food was passable but the breakfast the following morning was truly awful. There was an extra charge of 30 euros for a plain omlette. Staff, with the exception of reception, were inexperienced and not particularly helpful and the service in the bar was very slow. Would return to Venice in the future but would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil and sumptuous”
Reviews.Author: Unforgettable
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were sent to the Dei Dogi when the Boscolo Bellini had an unexpected overbooking. They could have put us in any room, but we were so fortunate with excellent accommodations. This 16th century monastery also served as the French embassy. This hotel is located in a peaceful area of Venice. We had a luxurious rose garden room with private patio just off the Venice lagoon. The location was gorgeous with views of the water and boats. The garden is amazingly beautiful. The room was sumptuous with marble floors, vaulted beam ceiling, murano glass chandeliers and rich fabrics. The hotel was very elegant. Desiring something more casual for dinner, the concierge recommended 40 Ladroni, a small local cafe on a canal which was popular with locals. The dinner was inexpensive and fantasic. We loved this restaurant so much we returned two nights later. In our thick, soft Boscolo robes, we enjoyed evening wine on the garden patio. We enjoyed our morning breakfast on the patio as well. We would have stayed more nights, but had already booked the Boscolo Bellini. Hotel Bellini was very nice, but in a much energetic location on the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service but tiny room!”
Reviews.Author: uksweets
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a long weekend in Venice over the August Bank Holiday.. Arrived at the Dei Dogi expecting a 5* hotel.. The service of the receptionist certainly appeared to support this, as when they ascertained that this was our first time in Venice, there was an in depth explanation of how Venice works, and how to get about on the vaparetto service.. The lobby was also pretty impressive, with the garden restaurant visible through the lobby. However, once we were shown to our room, I was rather taken aback by the size. It did have a King size bed (two singles pushed together, but this is usual in some hotels in Europe) and a dresser and chair that was so close to the bed that if you pulled the chair out you had no further room to walk round the bed. The bathroom was a tiny shower room, all very tastefully decorated in red marble and gold fittings (well - it keeps in tune with the hotel!) but again, there was very little room to manouevre. We were given the obligatory bathrobes and slippers, but there were no doorhooks or hangers in the bathroom, so we had to keep the robes hanging over the wardrobe doors just outside the bathroom in order to dry them out. We had dinner in the restaurant on Sunday evening and the service of the Head Waiter/Sommelier was impeccable, just like the courtesy and service from the reception staff. The food was ok, trying to be innovative and modern but in some dishes, failing terribly (my starter was scallops wrapped in prosciutto - which tasted oversalted because of the ham, and just overwhelmed the taste of the scallops), and a bit overpriced (dinner for two came up to EUR240 before tips. However, the night was well rounded off by dessert which was yummy! I had the chocolate souffle which is actually a chocolate fondant cake, with a mandarin jelly and scoop of vanilla ice cream. My boyfriend had the tiramisu which was also excellent. We were then given complimentary drinks (caiparinha for my boyfriend and a delicious almond dessert wine for myself), thanks to the prolonged conversations we were having with the Head Waiter about wine and cocktails.. The good thing about this hotel was the neighbourhood of Canareggio. Far away from the madding crowd of San Marco, it took us maybe 45 mins to wander back to our hotel from the piazza.. Taking in the Rialto bridge.. wandering up and through numerous mini-piazzas and over countless bridges that makes Venice so especially romantic.. For those times that we wanted to get straight to San Marco - there is a private water taxi "shuttle" service from the hotel that gets you there in 20 mins or so. Very convenient and very swanky - and best of all: free! Water taxis are so expensive that we didn't actually take any that we had to pay for! There is supposed to be a return shuttle service from San Marco back to the hotel, but we couldn't find the mooring. Anyway, it was nice to wander back on foot and take in the sights of the city. All in all - the 5* touches, such as having our bed turned down in the evening, with a couple of jelly sweets left on our pillow, made it seem like a 5* - and the service was excellent all round. But the actual room size and being located on ground floor was a definite negative. We paid a special rate of just EUR215 per night, but it really felt that we were (politely) shoved in a broom cupboard that had been converted into a room for our use.. The next morning however, we saw a few rooms with their doors open, ready to be cleaned by housekeeping and they were EVEN SMALLER than ours! I'm not sure if I would stay here again, I got a taster for real luxury at the Hotel Cipriani (we went there for dinner on one evening) and this, unfortunately, is just not in the same league!

Reviews.Title: “Three star luxury at five star rates”
Reviews.Author: chasmo75
Reviews.Content: During our two day stay we had the opportunity to reside in three different rooms due to air conditioning issues and cave-like atmospheres. If you reserve a room at this hotel we advise you to keep your bags packed so you have time to actually see Venice in betweem room changes. Of slight consolation was the opportunity to participate in their totally overpriced breakfast buffet at $22/Euro per person. This hotel must know someone that hands out the stars!! Don't do it!!!

Reviews.Title: “.. the good, the bad and the indifferent ..”
Reviews.Author: Paul71043
Reviews.Content: We booked a long weekend in the Dei Dogi in February 2005, having stayed in a Boscolo hotel in Lyon, where the accommodation was first class and the rate reasonable. We were attracted by the description of the hotel - in a converted palace with period decoration. Essentially, this is true. The Dei Dogi is indeed an impressive canal-side building with relatively large public spaces. It is also very convenient when arriving by water taxi from the airport. I agree with your other reviewers, that this hotel is a little distant from the centre of Venice, but this could be seen as an attraction. In any case, the canal-side walk to San Marco is no longer than fifteen minutes. The rooms were adequate but certainly not generous for the rate charged. The view from the windows was a blank wall. Despite comments from other reviewers, the air-conditioning did work, although this was in winter. Although the food was interesting and the service attentive, the restaurant lacks atmosphere and is massively over-priced There are cheaper and better restaurants locally. A major complaint is the internet booking system, operated by the Boscolo chain, when cheaper deals can be negotiated locally. It is galling to find that you have spent considerably more than your other guests when the website asured you that this was the 'lowest rate'. Despite the local staff being excellent, you will find that courteous but enquiring letters to managers and then to directors, about misleading advertising and charging, remain unanswered. And, do not take the trip organised by the hotel to the glassworks in Murano. It is a scam of which the hotel should be ashamed. That said, we would go again.

Reviews.Title: “A Concierge problem”
Reviews.Author: Cleveland_OhioKons
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 4 nights at this hotel and liked the fact that is away from the crowds. It's a beautiful property and we loved our stay there. However, I asked the concierge to investigate trains to Florence for me and he assured me that he would print out the information and get it to me but that never happened. At another hotel in Italy we asked for the same information and got a printout immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Laid back style in a quiet backwater”
Reviews.Author: ashleypair
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three day break at this Boscolo hotel in Venice. Having stayed at the Boscolo Exedra in Rome last year our expectations were high and I am pleased to report that they were generally met. The hotel is located in an old classical building and it boasts lots of marble, high ceilings and fancy chandeliers. It has 60+ rooms and ours was on the top floor and while not massive it was very comfortable and beams in the ceiling added a certain character. Other guests we spoke to however complained of smaller darker rooms on the lower floors so take care. Breakfast is served in a gazebo in the garden, which is lovely on a sunny morning but was a bit cold on a wet and windy May morning. The following morning though the hotel put breakfast in the inside dining room which was particularly nice. The hotel fronts a canal about 15 min walk from the Rialto bridge and 20 min from St Marks square. We made good use of the free water shuttle to St Marks which makes the round trip five or six times a day. The hotel boasts a private garden which is spectacular and since Dei Dogi is only a 5 min walk from the Orto water bus stop getting around is easy. The staff were very courteous and professional and added to an enjoyable break.

Reviews.Title: “No, no, a thousand times no.”
Reviews.Author: chefdiane
Reviews.Content: A beautiful building but the location is remote which puts you at the mercyof the staff, and that is the problem. On check out we were told not to take their shuttle, which is part of the price of the room. Four times we were advised to take bus 42 as the quickest possible route to the railway station. Our maps and info seemed different, but they were so insistant that we followed their advice. Bus 42 takes the route around Murano and ends 1 1/2 hours later at San Marco - where the shuttle goes in 20 minutes. The staff are intentionally misleading, very scarey people. The hotel is in a residential section, far from other hotels and so remote that there is no one else to help. If this is the only room in Venice, don't go to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel to hold our wedding reception and we also stayed in the hotel for 4 nights. The wedding reception that they organised for us was fantastic. The food and wedding cake they prepared was beautiful. All the staff were very helpful and kind. The hotel rooms are great as well. They also have a complementary boat service to take guests to St Mark's Square, very useful for the older guests!

Reviews.Title: “Over priced, out the way and needs a refurb”
Reviews.Author: HollersB
Reviews.Content: The common parts of the hotel are badly in need of a refurb - really scuffed and dirty (the lift has ripped cloth and grafitti). Our first bedroom we were shown had a broken air con unit that banged really noisily continuously. After the hotel begrudgingly showed us another room, we discovered our new room was in the process of a bathroom extension (through our closed bathroom window you could see where they were extending it) and smelt heavily of building works. We had the worst view in Venice overlooking a kitchen that was filled with paint cans. The staff were unhelpful, despite offering assistance with outings etc. they never called back. The rooms could be charming and you might be luckier than us in getting a better room - but I imagine that there are much safer and nicer options then this hotel. Definitely not worth the 5 stars or the price that we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Too bad it was only Two nights”
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay. Had a special $210 night rate with breakfast. Lovely room and bath ... view of the quiet canal. Breakfast was extensive and plenty to get you well past lunch. The coffee happened to be the best that I had in Rome, Florence anywhere .... yum! Located close to the vaporetto stop, or right on the canal if you can afford the taxi (60 euro ouch). Location was out of the way, but Venice really isn't that big. You could walk to San Marco in less than 10 minutes, but getting lost is the fun of Venice. As with any town, go there with a good map.

HotelInfo.Name: Boscolo Venezia, Autograph Collection
HotelInfo.Address: Fondamenta Madonna dell'Orto 3500 | Cannaregio, 30121 Venice, Italy
